loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina, de 50 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Cornelio de 46 años y lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila, ya que a su edad ya se dio el gusto de formar y sacar adelante a sus 03 queridos hijos. Marcelina, desde muy joven empezó a ganarse la vida trabajando de distintas formas,  ella se dedica a la venta de ropas y su puesto esta situado en el mercado de Kimbiri, donde Marcelina tiene su puesto de venta. En este lugar atiende a todos sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía, quienes la visitan continuamente, debido a los lindos y novedosos modelos de ropa que trae personalmente desde la ciudad de Lima. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientas sobre las prendas que mejor les quede, ya que de esta manera se distrae un poco, lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuando hay días en que la venta es baja. 
Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda más grande, en la cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es crédito numero 01 con MFP, se siente muy contenta de saber que obtendrá un apoyo por parte de los financistas, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo solicitado y esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará más ropa de Lima, de preferencia ropa liviana, ya que este tipo de ropa es la que más se vende en esta parte de la selva peruana
texts.en:
Marcelina, age 50, is a hardworking woman. She lives in her own home along with her husband Cornelio, age 46. What she wants most is to live peacefully in her retirement. Because of her age, Marcelina had the pleasure of training and bringing up her three beloved children. From a very early age, she began working in different ways. Marcelina sells clothes and has a stand at the market in Kimbiri where she conducts business. All of her customers come to this place and continue to do business with her because they are treated with great friendliness and courtesy. Marcelina offers beautiful and stylish clothing that she brings in personally from the city of Lima. What she enjoys most about her work is advising her customers which clothes look best on them. This also provides her with a little bit of a distraction. Marcelina has been in business for five years and considers the most difficult part to be dealing with days when her sales are low.

Over time, she wants to have a larger shop so that she can provide better service to her customers. This is her first loan with MFP and she is pleased to know that she has the support of the Kiva lenders. Since her ability to make purchases with this request has been secured, Marcelina is willing to submit her payments promptly and on schedule. This loan of 1000 PEN will be used to buy clothing from Lima, preferably lightweight garments. This type of clothing sells more frequently in this part of the Peruvian jungle.

loans.use: to buy lightweight clothing to sell.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma, es ama de casa, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 6 y 10 años de edad, él es agricultor y ella le apoya en estas actividades agrícolas, ya que se ven beneficiados los dos con la producción de maíz, su esposo aprendió de sus padres todo el proceso de la siembra y hasta el momento ha ganado mucha experiencia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para el pago de alquiler de dos manzanas de terreno, el cual utilizaran para sembrar, este préstamo les ayudara para disponer del dinero necesario para tener seguridad del terreno donde iniciaran pronto los cultivos.
El objetivo de Irma y su esposo, es trabajar juntos por el desarrollo de su hogar y sus hijos, manteniéndose unidos y trabajando arduamente.
texts.en:
Irma is a homemaker and lives with her husband and two children, ages 6 and 10. Her husband is a farmer and she helps with the farming activities. Their family benefits from their production of corn. Irma’s husband learned this trade from his parents, including the entire process of planting corn. To this moment, he has gained plenty of experience.

Irma is requesting a loan so that she can pay the rent on two plots of land that will be used for planting. This loan will help provide the necessary funds to secure land so that her family can begin planting their crops soon. The goal of Irma and her husband is to work together to develop their home and their children, as well as stay together and work hard.

loans.use: to pay the rent on two plots of farm land.

loans.name: Brigitte Adjovi

texts.fr: Agée de 60ans,Brigitte vit dans la maison de son mari avec ses trois enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de céréales et de divers à son domicile et fait ses emprunts dans les marchés environnants. Soucieuse d'augmenter son stock, elle sollicite un micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Le gain généré lui permettra d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement et le reste pour ses besoins.
texts.en: Brigitte, who is 60 years old, lives in her husband's house with her three children. Her main activity is the sale of cereals and other products from her home and she buys her products in the surrounding markets. She is requesting a micro-loan from Finadev so that she can increase her stock. The profits she makes will allow her to increase her capacity for getting more stock and she will use the rest for her own needs.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of corn, four sacks of flour and other diverse products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 25 años, es madre soltera, vive en casa alquilada junto a su querida hija Heidy de 03 años, a quien desea brindar un mejor futuro. El puesto de ventas de  María, es una de las más concurridas en el mercado de Kimbiri, el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por los pobladores, quienes realizan  sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera tienda en abrirse y la ultima en cerrarse. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus consumidores sobre la calidad y variedad de cada producto, lleva 03 meses en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda en espera de clientes ya que de eso depende sus ingresos económicos gracias a la venta de sus mercaderías María. Para el bien de su marcha  solicita el crédito para poder comprar las suministros necesarias para su puesto de ventas.  Este es crédito numero 01 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de los financistas para seguir prosperando. En su banco comunal es una socia participe.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará más provisiones para su tienda de abarrotes como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, leche y entre otros productos.
texts.en:
María, age 25, is a single mother who lives in a rented house with her beloved three-year-old daughter Heidy. She wants to provide her daughter a better future. Her vending post is one of the busiest spots at the market in Kimbiri. María is preferred by her customers because of her great charisma and the friendly service that she offers. Her customers make their purchases very early because they know when her business opens and the final moment before she closes. What she enjoys most about her work is advising her customers about the quality and variety of each of her products. María has been in business for three months and considers the most difficult part to be spending all day at her shop waiting on her customers. However, she knows that her income is dependent on the merchandise they buy from her. For the sake of keeping her business in operation, María is requesting a loan to buy the necessary merchandise for her vending post.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is very pleased to know that she has the support of the Kiva lenders to help her continue prospering. In her Communal Bank, María is an active participant. Her loan of 1000 PEN will be used to buy more provisions for her store such as sacks of rice, sugar, milk, and other products.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Adela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Adela, vive con sus dos hijos en casa familiar, ella se dedica crecer cerdos y luego venderlos, este oficio lo hace desde hace cuatro años y lo aprendió por iniciativa propia debido a la necesidad de ayudar a su familia.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar cuatro cerdos y harinilla para crecerlos y luego venderlos al mercado por un buen precio de esa forma podrá aumentar en sus ganancias.
El objetivo de Adela es siempre mantener su negocio estable, cada día tener fondos y lo necesario para el sostenimiento de sus hijos y ayudarles a que ellos estudien para sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Adela lives in the family home with her two children. She raises pigs for eventual resale. Adela has been in this business for four years and learned the trade on her own because she needed to help her family.

She needs a loan to buy four pigs and feed so that they can grow and be sold later at the market for a good price. This will help to increase her earnings. Adela’s goal is to always maintain a stable business and have the necessary funds each day to sustain her children. She also wants to help them with their studies so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy four pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Guadalupe Esmeralda

texts.es:
Guadalupe, vive con sus dos hijos de 15 y 7 años de edad  en casa familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de pescado y camarones en los hogares de los clientes, el oficio lo aprendió de su madre hace ocho años, vende todos los días de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar pescado y camarones, de esa forma podrá tener mejores ingresos y tendrá más variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
El sueño de Guadalupe es mantener siempre su negocio estable y de esa forma podrá mantener mejor a su familia, dándole lo necesario para el sustento diario.
texts.en:
Guadalupe lives in the family home with her two children, ages 15 and 7. She sells fish and shrimp by going to the homes of her customers. Guadalupe learned this trade from her mother eight years ago. She sells every day, Monday through Sunday.

Guadalupe needs a loan to buy fish and shrimp. This will enable her to earn more income and offer more variety to her customers. Her dream is to always maintain a stable business so that she can support her family and provide what they need for their daily sustenance.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 45 años, es una señora muy alegre y trabajadora, vive con su esposo Jorge de 45 años en su propia casa ya que todos sus hijos 05 ejercieron una carrera y son independientes. Olga, es una mujer muy laboriosa con su arduo trabajo pudo educar a sus 05 hijos y sacar profesional a cada uno de ellos. La bodega de Olga es muy frecuentado por sus compradores por el buen trato que brinda. Apertura las puertas de su negocio desde muy tempranas horas y están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega no dudan en comprarle. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes ya que es una de sus habilidades que emplea para ganar mayor cantidad de consumidores, lleva 08 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer de pie casi todo el transcurso del día. Con el crédito solicitado comprara más mercadería  para su negocio. Con el tiempo piensa incrementar sus ganancias comprando bebidas, golosinas y frutas para hacer su rica cremolada. Este es crédito numero 02 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que obtendrá apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de comprar lo sugerido y  esta muy contenta  de pertenecer  a su banca comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará productos para abastecer su bodega.
texts.en:
Olga, age 45, is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She lives with her husband Jorge, age 45, in their own home. All five of her children are independent and have a career. Olga is an industrious woman who worked hard to educate her five children and help them to become professionals. Her store is frequented by customers because of the good service that she provides. The doors of her business are opened very early in order to receive her first customers. They know that she offers a variety of merchandise in her store, so they do not hesitate to buy from her. What Olga enjoys most about her work is being able to converse with her customers. One of the skills that she uses is persuading her customers to buy more products. Olga has been in business for eight years and says the most difficult part is being on her feet for almost the entire day. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more merchandise for her business. Over time, she plans to increase her earnings by purchasing beverages, candies, and fruits for making her delicious smoothies.

This is her second loan with MFP. Olga is pleased to know that she can obtain financial support. She feels secure in knowing that she can buy more inventory and is pleased to be part of her Communal Bank. Her loan of 1000 PEN will be used to buy products to restock her store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Las Brillantes De La Q Group

texts.es: La Sra. Carla de 27 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos los cuales aún dependen de ella. Lleva 1 año siendo socia de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de ropa en general, negocio con el cual lleva 2 años. Comenzó a raíz de poder dar una buena educación a sus hijos y obtener más ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades. También se dedica a dar clases particulares para niños. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo está dando una buena educación a sus hijos. Actualmente sus ingresos los destina a cubrir los gastos de agua y luz, mientras que su pareja cubre los gastos de alimentación y educación. Su plan para el futuro es comprarse un terreno para que construya su casa y alquilar un nuevo puesto para el aumento de su negocio. Ella usara el crédito en la compra de mercadería. Carla pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Las Brillantes de la Q”, con el cual tiene 1 año y está conformado por 6 personas. Lleva 4 meses ocupando el cargo de presidenta.
texts.en:
Sra. Carla is 27 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children who are dependent on her. She has been a member of EDAPROSPO for one year and earns her living by selling clothes. Carla has been in business for two years. She started her business because she wanted to provide a good education for her children and generate more income to cover their needs. Carla also provides private tutoring sessions to children. Through her work and effort, she has been able to give her children a good education. Her income currently covers the water and electricity expenses. In the meantime, her partner covers the food and education expenses. Her plans for the future are to buy a plot of land for building a house and to rent a new vending post so that she can expand her business.

Carla will use her loan to buy merchandise. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brillantes de La Q”, which has been in existence for one year and currently has six members. For the past four months, Carla has served as president.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gwladys Mercy

texts.fr: Gwladys est une femme dynamique, mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente des mêches, produits cosmétiques,sacs,pagnes et autres et s'approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. En vue de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle,elle sollicite un micro-crédit à Finadev afin d'accroître son stock de marchandises et de maximiser son profit pour le bien- être de sa famille.
texts.en: Gwladys is a dynamic woman, married with three children.  She specializes in the sale of hair extensions, cosmetics, pagnes (colorful West -African fabrics), bags etc. She buys her merchandise from local markets.  In order to meet her customers' needs, she is requesting a micro-loan from Finadev to increase her stock of goods, maximize profits, and ensure her family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy 50 hair extensions, 50 cosmetics, 10 bags and 15 pagnes.

loans.name: Maria Delmy

texts.es:
María, vive en casa propia con su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y bebidas, el oficio lo aprendió debido a la necesidad de obtener mejores ingresos,no tiene un horario establecido puesto que el negocio lo tiene en su casa.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar la materia prima como: leña, maíz, gas propano, de esa manera podrá atender mejor a la clientela y tener lo necesario para aumentar en sus ganancias.
El sueño de María es siempre tener su negocio estable y lo necesario para el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en: María lives in her own home with her family.  She works selling tortillas and drinks.  She learned the business because she needed to obtain more income.  She does not have an established schedule since the business is located in her home.  She will use her loan to purchase raw material such as wood, corn, and propane gas, and in that way serve her clientele better and have all the necessities to grow her earnings.  Maria's dream is always to have a stable business and what is necessary to sustain her family.

loans.use: To purchase corn, wood and gas.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La señora Maria Esther  solicita un préstamo para poder iniciar la construcción de un cuarto; el cual les falta para que todos los integrantes de la familia tengan su espacio personal. 
Doña Maria Esther  trabaja como vendedora de teléfonos móvil con una antigüedad de cinco años,  y su esposo como  chofer de un taxi  actividad que tiene practicando más de 14 años.
Ambos son originarios de Nuevo Laredo, tiene tres hijas, una de ellas ya esta casada y las otras dos aun viven con ella.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Esther is requesting a loan so that she can begin the construction of a room. Everyone in her family lacks their own personal space.

Doña Maria Esther works as mobile phone saleswoman and has five years of experience. Her husband is a taxi driver who has been in that profession for more than 14 years. Both of them are from Nuevo Laredo. They have three daughters, one of whom is already married while the other two live with them.

loans.use: to begin the construction of a room in her house.

loans.name: Estefany

texts.es: La joven Estefany a sus 21 años trabaja en una librería de una tía en la cual lleva cuatro años y ha aprendido de esta labor gracias a la oportunidad que le brindaron. La jornada de trabajo es de lunes a sábado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, esta actividad la alterna con el préstamo de servicios de belleza a domicilio los fines de semana y así puede generar mayores ingresos para su sustento y el de su familia. La joven Estefany requiere de la compra de libros e impresión de textos con el ánimo de mejorar las ventas y con estas la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Estefany is 21 years old and works at her aunt’s bookstore.  She has worked there for four years, and has learned a lot from her job thanks to the opportunity it has given her.  She works Mondays to Saturdays from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM.  She alternates this activity with providing in-house beauty services on weekends.  That way she can generate more income to support herself and her family.  Estefany needs to purchase books and printed texts so that she can improve sales, and thus improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase books.

loans.name: Leticia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Leticia, se dedica a la venta de comida y atoles, vive con su esposo quien es agricultor, el negocio lo tiene instalado frente al seguro social de su localidad, en las mañanas vende atol y panes, en la mediodía vende comida, este negocio lo inicio con su madre y cuenta con experiencia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para preparar la comida y los atoles, como aceite, condimentos, arroz, frijoles, platos desechables, bolsas plásticas, azúcar y más productos.
Esta compra le ayudara a Leticia a mejorar su situación en el negocio, también para que su familia tenga mayores beneficios.
texts.en:
Leticia has a business selling food and atol (a traditional corn-based beverage).  She lives with her husband, who is a farmer.  She has her business set up in front of the Social Security office in her town.  In the mornings, she sells atol and bread, and at noon she starts selling food.  She started this business with her mother, and she has experience in this line of work.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies to make her food and atol drinks, such as cooking oil, condiments, rice, beans, disposable plates, plastic bags, sugar, and other products.  These purchases will help Leticia to improve her business so that she can better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, condiments, rice, beans, disposable plates, plastic bags, and sugar

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther de 37 años, convive con Alberto de 35 años de edad; viven en su propia casa junto a sus 04 hijos a quienes brinda lo mejor. Esther, a su edad es una persona de negocio, que sabe como administrar entre las labores de sus casa y su pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Es por eso que atiende a su familia muy temprano para así disponer de tiempo en su quiosco, con  el apoyo de su pareja se esmera para seguir adelante y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Para Esther su bodega le es muy  rentable porque vende su mercadería a precios cómodos y sabe como atender  a sus consumidores. En su negocio trabaja hace 08 años en su propia casa situada en el distrito de Kimbiri, con el tiempo que lleva en el negocio ya obtuvo buenos ingresos, razón por la cual piensa ampliar su negocio y disponer mayor cantidad de productos. Este es crédito numero 01 con MFP, esta comprometida para pagar sus cuotas, ya que no quiere ocasionar problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, mejorará su quiosco, a la vez comprará más mercaderías.
texts.en:
Esther is 37 years old, and lives with Alberto who is 35 years old. They live in their own house together with her 4 children to whom she gives her best.

Esther, at her age, is a business person who knows how to balance her household work and her little grocery store. This is why she takes care of her family very early so that she has the time for her kiosk. With the support of her partner she does her best to get ahead and provide for her children.

For Esther her store is very profitable because she sells her merchandise at affordable prices and she knows how to care for her buyers. She has been in business for 8 years in her own house located in the district of Kimbiri. From the time she has been in business she has made good income, and this is the reason she is thinking of expanding her business and displaying a larger number of products.

This is her first loan through MFP, and she is committed to making her payments, because she does not want to bring about problems for the members of her communal bank, where she feels very happy.

With the 1500 soles, she will improve her kiosk by buying more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy materials to expand and stock her kiosk

loans.name: Gloria Ayde

texts.es:
Gloria, vive con su familia y sus hijos, ella administra una tienda de productos básicos como: arroz, azúcar, café instantáneo y también vende frutas y verduras el cual las sale a vender en los hogares de las personas, todos los días de la semana.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar productos de la canasta básica como: arroz, aceite, frijoles y frutas, guineos, manzanas, a si podrá tener variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes y podrá tener mejores ingresos debido a la época.
El sueño de Gloria es fortalecer mejor su negocio y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria lives with her family and her children.  She has a store where she sells basic consumer goods such as rice, sugar, and instant coffee, and she also sells fruits and vegetables.  She goes out to sell her fruits and vegetables door-to-door every day of the week.

Gloria needs a loan to buy basic consumer products such as rice, cooking oil, beans, fruit, bananas and apples.  This way she can have a variety of products to offer to her customers, and will have greater seasonal earnings.

Gloria's dream is to strengthen her business and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, beans, fruit, bananas and apples

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es: Maria Susana tiene  su actividad económica que es la venta de tortilla, ella ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, en cual no es su primera vez que trabaja con crédito y ha sido una clienta muy responsable. Maria Susana emprende este negocio que a pesar de ser muy humilde es un ejemplo para sus hijos de cómo se debe ganar la vida honradamente. Maria Susana actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de materia prima y poder brindarles a sus clientes el servicio.
texts.en:
Maria Susana sells tortillas. She has already had credit from Fundación León 2000, so this isn't the first time she has worked with a loan, and she has been a very responsible client.

Maria Susana is undertaking this business, which, although very modest, is an example for her children of how to earn an honest living. 

At this time, Maria Susana is applying for a loan to invest in her business through the purchase of raw material, and to be able to offer service to her customers.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making tortillas.

loans.name: Rosa Irman

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer divorciada de 45 años quien vive con su hija menor de 21 años en  "San Miguel de los Bancos" que es uno de las 9 cantones de la Provincia de Pichincha ubicado en la zona noroccidental del Ecuador, posee 52 centros poblados entre comunidades, recintos y cooperativas distribuidas en toda la geografía cantonal. El territorio cantonal se encuentra un importante recurso natural como es el Bosque Protector Mindo Nambillo. Una gran superficie del área cantonal se encuentra ocupada de pastizales ya que la principal actividad del cantón es la ganadería este cultivo, también se realizan cultivos de palmito, caña de azúcar, plátano, naranjilla en pequeñas superficies. Rosa en sus tiempos libres trata de pasar con su hija y en si la actividades del hogar.

Esta emprendedora se dedica a preparar comida para venderla, no tiene un local para recibir a sus clientes por lo que lo hace a domicilio. La contratan también para atender eventos sociales y los fines de semana saca una pequeña carpa afuera de su casa para vender su comida. Nos comenta que su jornada laboral empieza a las 6 de la mañana por lo general y termina en la tarde a las 16:00. Cuando atiende a muchas personas el trabajo es duro ya que las ollas en las que debe cocinar tienen un gran tamaño y comúnmente trabaja sola. Ella quisiera tener su restaurante ya que su oficio le gusta mucho y para empezar ella desea invertir en implementos que le hacen falta para mejorar su negocio y para ello acudirá a solicitar su primer crédito.

Rosa está optimista y poco a poco estará más cerca de su sueño que es un restaurante amplio y bonito donde pueda seguir cocinando para su clientela.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 45-year-old woman who is divorced and lives with her youngest child who is 21 years old. They live in San Miguel de los Bancos which is one of the nine cantons in the Province of Pichincha, located in the north-western zone of Ecuador. The entire geographical area of the canton has 52 populated areas throughout including communities, precincts and villages. Within the canton's territory one can find Bosque Protector Mindo Nambillo [Mindo Nambillo Protected Forest], an important natural resource. A large portion of the canton is made up of pastures as the principal business in the canton is animal husbandry. There is also a lot of palmetto cultivation as well as sugar cane, plantains, and naranjilla in small areas. In her free time, Rosa tries to spend time with her daughter and in household activities. 

This hard working woman makes a living preparing meals for sale. She does not have a storefront to receive her customers, so she makes home deliveries. She is also contracted to serve at social events and on the weekends she puts up a small tent outside of her house to sell her food. She tells us that her work day begins at six in the morning in general and ends at four in the afternoon. When she has a lot of customers the work is very hard because the pots that she cooks the food in are very big and she often works alone. She would like to have a restaurant because she likes her work a lot. To start, she wants to invest in equipment that she is lacking to improve her business, which is why she will request her first loan.

Rosa is optimistic and little by little she will be closer to her dream of having a large and pretty restaurant where she can continue to cook for her customers.

loans.use: to make improvements to her food business.

loans.name: Ibrahima Layré

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père de trois enfants. Il conduit un taxi de transport urbain dans sa localité.Son activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille. Il assure ainsi les frais de scolarité, de santé et les dépenses d'alimentation. Malheureusement, son taxi est tombé en panne de moteur.C'est pourquoi, il sollicite un pret de 450 000f pour acheter un moteur neuf afin de reprendre son travail et entretenir sa famille.Son ambition est de disposer d'un parc de taxi de transport dans la ville.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married man and father of three children.  He drives an urban transport taxi in his area.  His business is what allows him to meet his ends and those of his family. Through this, he is able to pay for tuition, health, and food expenses.

Unfortunately, his taxi broke down. This is why he is asking for a loan of 450,000 francs [XOF] in order to purchase a new engine so he can start working again and continue to support his family.

His aspiration is to have a fleet of taxicabs in the city.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine.

loans.name: Roxana Emperatriz

texts.es:
Roxana, es comerciante de verdura, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos quienes están estudiando, sus edades son de 8, 10 y 16 años, ella administra el comercio de verduras y lo realiza por medio de un vehículo en el sale a ofrecer la mercadería, por los cantones y zonas cercanas, tiene una experiencia de 10 años.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de verdura fresca, papas, güisquiles, repollo, tomates, y otros más que son necesarios en los hogares de los clientes, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar la disponibilidad de productos, mejorando sus ventas.
La aspiración de Roxana es que su negocio crezca, pudiendo abarcar más zonas para generar más utilidades y ofrecer a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Roxana sells vegetales. She lives with her husband, and their three children, who are in school. Their ages are 8, 10, and 16.

She runs a vegetable business, which she does using a vehicle. She goes out to sell the merchandise around the villages and nearby areas. She has 10 years of experience. 

She is applying for a loan to buy fresh vegetables, such as potatoes, gúisquiles (pear squash), cabbages, tomatoes, and others that are needed in customers' homes. This purchase will help her to improve the selection of products, and improve her sales. 

Roxana's ambition is for her business to grow. This will enable her to cover more areas, generate more earnings, and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, gúisquiles (pear squash), cabbages, tomatoes.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma, de 24 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos queridos hijos y su pareja Richard de 25 años de edad, quien apoya para que puedan sobresalir adelante. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana Vilma abre su tienda de abarrotes para atender a sus vecinos, ella es una vendedora muy hábil, sabe como tratar a sus clientes y siempre los termina convenciendo de comprar algo más. Su tienda esta muy bien surtida de productos de primera necesidad tales como arroz, leche, variedad de cereales y menestras ya que siempre se preocupa por comprar los productos más consumidos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su entorno vecinal, lleva 02 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el lapso del día. Vilma solicita el crédito para poder comprar  lo necesario para su bodega. Para el bien de sus ingresos económicos más adelante espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, para poder vender más productos. Este será su crédito numero 01 con MFP, manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y está segura que contara con el apoyo de todos ustedes. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará más sacos de arroz, azúcar conservas y entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Vilma is 24 years old. She is a working woman and lives in her own house with her 2 darling children and her partner, Richard, who is 25 years old, and who supports her so they can excel in the future. Every day, very early in the morning, Vilma opens her grocery store in order to tend to her neighbors. She is a very skillful saleslady; she knows how to treat her clients and always finishes up by convincing them to buy something more.

Her store is very well supplied with staples such as rice, milk, and a variety of grains and beans, and she is always worrying to buy the products most used. 

What she likes most about her work is chatting with her customers and learning about the things going on in her surrounding neighborhood. She has been doing this for 2 years and what she considers the most difficult is to have to be on her feet all day long.

Vilma is asking for a loan in order to be able to buy what is necessary for her store. In order to have financial income going forward she is hoping to expand the facilities of her store in order to be able to sell more products. 

This will be her first loan with MFP, and she declares that the money from the loan will help her a lot in the progress of her work and she is certain that she can count on the support of all of you. With the 1000 soles she will buy bags of rice, sugar, preserved food and other items.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, sugar, preserved food, and milk

loans.name: Roseline Thècle

texts.fr: Madame Roseline est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est coiffeuse de profession, mais a laissé pour le moment cette activité parce que celle ci ne lui marche plus bien. Elle vend des mèches de tous types, des produits SOBEBRA glacés, bissap glacé et non préparé. Son fonds est situé à son domicile. Vue la situation géographique de son fonds, elle sollicite le concours de Finadev afin de diversifier son activité. Le revenu supplémentaire lui permettra d'améliorer les conditions de vie économique et sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Roseline is married and has one child. She is a hairstylist by trade but has left this work for now because it is no longer doing well. She sells hair extensions of any type, ice-cold SOBEBRA products, ice-cold bissap drink (made from hibiscus flowers), and raw bissap. Her business is situated in her home. 
 
Given the geographic location of her business, she is requesting assistance from Finadev to diversify her business. The extra revenues will enable her to improve her family's social and economic situation.

loans.use: to buy 50 assorted hair extensions, 10 assorted containers, and other goods

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia, de 52 años, natural del distrito de Kimbiri es una señora muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo Toribio de 52 años y sus 03 hijos en su casa propia. Virginia, es una mujer muy laboriosa con su arduo trabajo educa a sus 03 hijos y solventa en los gastos de familia y los estudiso de ellos.  La bodega de Virginia, es la primera en abrirse en su barrio situado en el distrito de Kimbiri, abre las puertas de su negocio desde las 06 de la mañana y ya están listas para recibir a sus primeros compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio. Lleva 14 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela incrementar mercadería para su tienda.  Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a las compañeras de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará más mercadería para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Virginia, is 52 years old and from the Kimbiri district.  She is a very hard working woman.  She lives with her husband Toribio, age 52, and their 3 children, in a home they own.  Virginia works a lot and with her hard work she has educated her 3 children, covering household expenses and their education.  

Virginia's store is the first one to open in her neighborhood in the Kimbiri district.  The doors of her business are open starting at 6am, when she's ready to receive the first shoppers, who shop there because they know the variety of merchandise she carries. What she likes best about her job is talking with her customers and learning about what is happening in the neighborhood.  She has had this business for 14 years.  The hardest part of her job is having to be in the store all day, without being able to leave.  Over time, she would like to increase the stock of merchandise in her store.  

This will be her first loan with MFP, and she expects to pay it on time, since she does not want to cause problems for the other women in her communal bank.  She is very respected in the communal bank because she brings order to the group.  With these 1,500 new soles, she will purchase additional merchandise to better stock her general store.

loans.use: to purchase additional basic needs products to stock her store.

loans.name: Olga Mery

texts.es: La señora Olga Mery con 37 años de edad es auxiliar de confección, y tiene 3 hijos por los que trabaja todos los días para cubrirle sus necesidades. Su compañera de confección le brindó un espacio donde poder comercializar mercancía, actividad que la señora Olga Mery realiza para generar otros ingresos y poder cubrir los gastos del hogar. Sueña con poder brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación y con que su negocio crezca cada vez mas, por lo que requiere de la compra de mercancía para ampliar los productos que le ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en: Olga Mery is 37 years old and is a dressmaker’s assistant.  She has 3 children, and works every day so she can provide for their needs.  Her dressmaking co-worker has provided her with a space where she can sell merchandise.  This activity makes it possible for Olga Mery to generate additional income and to cover the household expenses.  Her dream is to be able to provide her children with a good education and for her business to grow more.  She needs a loan in order to purchase merchandise so she can increase the products that she offers her customers.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise so she can increase her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchae rice, sugar, fideo pasta, and milk.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma lives in the coastal town of Likoni, Kenya. She is married and has three children. 

Mwanajuma owns a boutique which has been in operation for eleven years. She began her business from the personal savings of informal groups commonly called ‘merry go round’. Mwanajuma is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase clothes, handbags etc. Her main challenge is price fluctuations. She looks forward to opening a cosmetic shop. 

Mwanajuma will use the extra income generated from this loan to purchase a shelf for display.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, handbags etc to sell

loans.name: Ana Dilia

texts.es:
Ana, administra un comedor, está casada, vive con su familia, sus hijos son independientes, tiene una experiencia de 11 años en el negocio, este lo aprendió por sus amigas, en la actualidad tiene muchos clientes.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos para el negocio, como arroz, frijoles, carnes, pollo, aceite, condimentos, para mantener suficiente disponibilidad para sus clientes, surtiendo el negocio para aumentar la producción.
Ella quiere mantenerse en el negocio, ya que de él ha logrado subsistir y mejorar la atención a su familia, apoyándoles en todo momento.
texts.en:
Ana runs a small restaurant.  She is married and lives with her family.  Her children support themselves.  She has had this business for 11 years, which she learned from her friends.  She has many customers. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase products for her business such as rice, beans, meat, chicken, cooking oil and condiments in order to have enough for her customers, stocking the business and increasing production.  

She would like to continue running the business because it has helped her make a living and provide greater attention to her family, supporting them at all times.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, meat, chicken, cooking oil, and condiments.

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es:
Mauro, administra un taller de enderezado y pintura automotriz,  vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, uno de sus hijos le ayuda a realizar algunas actividades en el taller, el trabaja desde hace 5 años, inicio como ayudante, y hace dos años instalo su propio taller en el cual contrata de manera eventual a un ayudante.
Actualmente Mauro solicita un préstamo para la compra de masilla, pinturas, sierras, fibra de vidrio, para poder realizar su trabajo, esta inversión le ayudara para tener los materiales necesarios y ahorrarse en su compra con la obtención de precios bajos por adquirirlos al contado.
Su Aspiración es crecer con más capacidad para mejorar su trabajo, ganarse más clientes y que su familia tengan una mejor forma de vida.
texts.en:
Mauro operates an auto paint and body repair business.  He lives with his wife and their three children, one of whom helps him with the business.  He's operated the shop for 5 years.  He started as an employee of another repair business before opening his own shop two years ago.  He then hired an employee to help him.
Mauro is applying for a loan to buy mastic, paint, tools and other supplies for the business.  The loan will allow him to save money when he buys the supplies he needs because he will get a discount for paying cash.  
Mauro's goal is to draw more customers and grow his business.  The extra income will allow him to better support his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his paint and body repair business.

loans.name: Assiba Irène Théodora

texts.fr: Mariée, Assiba vit en location avec son enfant. Coiffeuse de profession, elle y associe la vente des mêches, défrisants et autres dans une boutique de sa localité. Pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et maximiser son profit, elle a sollicité et obtenu un micro-crédit à Finadev afin de satisfaire la demande de ses clients et de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Assiba is a married woman who rents a place with her child. A hairdresser by trade, she has included the sale of hair extensions, hair straightener, and other products in her salon in town. 

To increase her sales and to maximize her profit, Assiba requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev to meet the demands of her customers and to help cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 20 hair extensions, 20 lengths of cloth, and 10 cosmetic items

loans.name: Cica Angèle

texts.fr: Angèle est mariée avec un enfant. Elle est distributrice de tissus Binta, Hitarget, Hollandais, glacières, bassines et autres. Dans le but de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, elle souhaite bénéficier d'un renouvellement de son micro crédit à Finadev visant à maximiser ses intérêts et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. Ce qui lui permettra de mieux faire face aux charges familiales,pour un mieux être de sa famille.
texts.en: Angèle is married, has a child, and distributes Binta, Hitarget, and Hollandais brand fabrics; insulated containers (coolers); and more. With the goal of satisfying the needs of her customers, she would like to benefit from a renewal of her micro-loan with Finadev, so as to maximize her investments and to increase her sales. This will enable her to cope better with family expenses and thus to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: 15 mixed fabrics

loans.name: Pedro Luis

texts.es:
Pedro es un joven de 23 años, ha vivido toda su vida en "San Miguel de los Bancos" que es uno de las 9 cantones de la Provincia de Pichincha (donde también se encuentra la capital del Ecuador). Posee 52 centros poblados entre comunidades, recintos y cooperativas distribuidas en toda la geografía cantonal. El territorio cantonal se encuentra un importante recurso natural como es el Bosque Protector Mindo Nambillo. Una gran superficie del área cantonal se encuentra ocupada de pastizales ya que la principal actividad del cantón es la ganadería este cultivo, también se realizan cultivos de palmito, caña de azúcar, plátano, naranjilla en pequeñas superficies. Hace un año vive de manera independiente y a pesar de tener un hijo, no vive junto a él.

Sus padres tienen una tienda de productos naturistas y de ellos, Pedro aprendió este oficio. Desde hace 5 años él tiene su propio local que ha tenido una buena acogida. Desea realizar una inversión en mas mercadería, quiere incrementar el surtido y para ello debe realizar un crédito ya que de otra manera no podría hacerlo. De esta manera piensa mejorar la oferta hacia sus clientes y por ende tener mejores ingresos. Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución que le ayudará con esta necesidad económica, ha evaluado su negocio y ha determinado que es un emprendedor sólido y confía en que podrá cumplir sus pagos puntualmente.

Este joven está muy optimista y sueña con tener un local bien abastecido y surtido, de esta manera con mejores ingresos tener una mejor calidad de vida y algún día poder tener sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Pedro, 23, has lived all his life in San Miguel de los Bancos, one of 9 cantons in Pichincha, an Ecuadorea province that includes the country's capital city.  There are 52 "comunidades", "recintos" and "cooperativas distribuidas" [local geographical entities] in the canton, along with important resources such as the Mindo Nambillo National Forest.  Much of the canton is pasture land and ranching is an important business.  Local farmers grow palmito, sugar cane, platanos and fruit on small plots here.  Pedro has lived on his own for a year.  He has a son, but the son doesn't live with him.

Pedro's parents have a natural medicines business and he learned the business from them.  He opened his own shop 5 years ago and has made good progress.  He wants to expand the business now and he needs a loan because he can't add the inventory he wants without one.  He wants to increase the range of merchandise that he sells so that he can increase his income.  Fundacion Alternativa, the bank that is helping him with the loan, has assessed the business and determined that Pedro is a solid, trustworthy businessman who can repay the loan in the agreed-upon time.

This optimistic young man wants to build a successful business that will provide him with a good income.  His goals are a better quality of life and to one day go to university.

loans.use: to stock his natural medicines business.

loans.name: Eyra De La Soledad

texts.es: Eyra de la Soledad ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, y ha sido una clienta responsable y mantiene su record crediticio limpio, su actividad continua siendo la crianza de cerdos y gallinas en cual nos expresa Eyra que gracias al financiamiento que le brindaron a aumentado su clientela con los cerdos y la gallina que compro con el financiamiento. Eyra actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir más en el negocio en la compra de cerdos y gallinas y el alimento de los animales.
texts.en: Eyra de la Soledad is a long-time Fundacion Leon 2000 customer and a responsible borrower with a good record of repaying her loans.  She makes a living raising and selling pigs and chickens.  She tells us that she used past loans to buy more pigs and chickens and the investment helped her to find new customers.  Eyra is applying for a new loan, part of which she will use to buy more animals and the rest to buy animal feed.

loans.use: to buy animals for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Bassirou

texts.fr: Monsieur Bassirou habite au Sénégal  et est âgé de 35 ans. C’est un père de famille qui a  2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 5 et 7 ans. Il évolue  dans le secteur de la pêche  depuis plus de 15 ans. Il a choisi cette activité par amour. Etant issu d’une famille de pêcheur  il pratique cette activité depuis le bas âge. Ce qui l’y intéresse  c’est la capture de poissons et les revenus qui lui sont procurés. Il est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis février 2006. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour la réfection de sa pirogue en cette période de repos des pêcheurs  a cause de la marée haute. Son souhait est d’améliorer ses revenus  et le cadre de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Bassirou lives in Senegal and is 35 years old.  He is a family man, with two children, 5 and 7 years old.  He has been working in the fishing industry for more than 15 years.  He has chosen this activity because he loves it.  Being from a family of fishermen, Bassirou has been fishing from a very early age.  He particularly likes catching fish and generating revenues from this activity.  He has been a member of the local UIMCEC branch since February 2006.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 200,000 CFA francs to repair his boat during this period of high tide which is a rest period for fishermen.  Bassirou wishes to increase his income and to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To repair his fishing boat.

loans.name: Hector Homero

texts.en:
With experience from the El Paso Chamber of Commerce and seven years of teaching Hispanic entrepreneurship, 72-year-old H. Homero is titled the El Paso Business Coach. This is a name his son titled him with to bring in more business. H. Homero said he has witnessed small businesses struggle, stay small, and sometimes, flop. This encouraged him to begin The Ascend: Entrepreneurial Growth. The company is almost three years old now. H. Homero noticed a need to build a stronger economy and stop the cost of business. “We won’t build our economy if we don’t build ourselves,” he stated. The Ascend: Entrepreneurial Growth assists in coaching small businesses on maturity, building infrastructure and creating a system to ensure a business works as an organization.

Through his business, H. Homero offers a workshop at no cost to local business owners entitled: “Blueprint for Business Growth.” He, as well, has others that he charges for. H. Homero’s main advantage is the offered one-on-one coaching of his clients and reasonable price compared to major franchise groups. Since he offers the one-on-one coaching, H. Homero’s assistance is client-limited. Because of this, he works with anywhere from a dozen to 20 clients annually. 

The current hindrance for H. Homero’s business is his marketing presence. H. Homero stressed the complications of working with minor businesses. He said, “The trick is to bring (his coaching) to those who can’t afford it.” H. Homero expressed that he would love to decrease his prices for those who want and need his help, but at the moment, he cannot afford to do so. H. Homero requested the loan to purchase office equipment and market his business. His primary goal for The Ascend: Entrepreneurial Growth has not been as dramatically accomplished as he expected, he said, however the loan from ACCION Texas has helped. A returning client, H. Homero said one of things that happens as a small business is that projects and advancements such as purchasing software or other supplies are put off until capital is earned, which in turn, holds the business process. “The loan helps me grow the business now,” he said.

H. Homero’s work involves educating other entrepreneurs. He said the company is trying to break ground and bring people to his office. As he noticed, other businesses are using their profit to pay franchised business coaches to teach them rudimentary skills they really do not need to pay for. He added: 89 percent of small business owners are sole proprietors leaving that one person to cover every expense and find solutions to every problem, something he is familiar with. H. Homero is also a sole proprietor of his business who sometimes collaborates with other successful business owners. He, too, has learned about small business and entrepreneurship by conducting first-hand interviews with now household names of different industries. 
To find out more about H. Homero and his business, visit his website at: http://www.ascendeg.com. To view his interviews with major corporation heads, visit heho.utep.edu.

loans.use: To pay for software and office supplies.

loans.name: Olmedo Enrique

texts.es: Olmedo  de 80 años es un hombre muy trabajador,  que vive al sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposa y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 26 a 49 años. Su negocio lo inició hace 15 años cuando comercializaba pescado que traía de Tasajera, un pueblo pescador  del departamento del Magdalena; desde ese momento reunió su primer capital de trabajo, con el cual cambió de actividad para dedicarse a la venta de mercancía, porque cada vez se le hacia mas difícil viajar diariamente. Hoy en su negocio como comerciante le ha ido muy bien y aporta ingresos a su familia y con ello ha logrado ayudar al bienestar de esta. La mercancía la compra en el centro de la ciudad y la vende a  clientes ubicado alrededor de su barrio y muchos de ellos están empleados en empresas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, noveno crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará mercancías varias, como calzado y vestuario, solicitadas por sus clientes para vestirse elegantes, en fechas especiales como navidad y el recibimiento del año 2012 .
texts.en: Olmedo, 80, is a hard-working man.  He lives in a southern neighborhood of Barranquilla with his wife.  He has 4 children who range in age from 26 to 49.  He started his own business 15 years ago, selling fish that he brought from Tasajera, a fishing town in the "departamento" of Magdalena.  Traveling back and forth to Tasajera became difficult, but he keeps the business going buying and selling whatever merchandise he thinks his customers will buy.  The business is a success and provides him with enough income to support his family.  He buys merchandise in the central Barranquilla and sells what he buys to customers in his neighborhood, many of whom work for other local businesses.  Olmedo is applying to Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo for this, his ninth Kiva loan, so that he can buy merchandise, clothing and footwear that his customers want for the coming holidays.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina, de 27 años de edad, convive con su pareja  Víctor de 30 años; fruto de ese amor  tienen una hija. Juntos residen su propia casa donde su mayor anhelo es salir adelante. Dina se mantiene sola desde los 21 años, su sueño era  tener su propia tienda de abarrotes, pero por cosas del destino, se dedicó a la producción y comercialización de ladrillos de manera artesanal, desde luego que no se arrepiente, ya que le está resultando buenas satisfacciones económicas. Actualmente los vende en la localidad de Pichari, ya que es una localidad que esta en constante crecimiento económico y poblacional; en efecto que ya tiene compradores potenciales, por la buena calidad y tiempo de entrega que lo ofrece a sus clientes. Normalmente ella trabaja con su pareja y juntos realizan su trabajo por salir adelante, pero siempre necesitan de sus colaboradores, para que lo puedan facilitar en producir en un tiempo menor. Su punto de venta lo realiza en su misma planta de elaboración; gracias a su trabajo llego a comprar un carro de carga para que pueda trasladar sus ladrillos hacia su cliente final, con el propósito de minimizar costo y tiempo. Este es crédito numero 08 con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando de manera puntual y eficiente, además se siente satisfecho con su banco comunal, por los beneficios que otorga.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, invertirá en su ladrillería comprando materiales para la actividad que realiza.
texts.en:
27-year-old Dina lives together with her partner Víctor who is 30 years old.  The couple have one daughter.  They live together in their own home and their biggest desire is to get ahead in life.  Dina has been supporting herself since she was 21.  Her dream was to own her own grocery store but fate had other plans and she started producing and selling hand-made bricks instead.  She does not regret this, however, as the business is providing her with a lot of financial satisfaction.  She currently sells her products in the town of Pichari as this is a town which is experiencing constant growth both in financial and demographic terms.  She has potential buyers because of the good quality of her bricks and the delivery time that she offers her customers.  She generally works with her partner and they both carry out their work so that they can get ahead in life.  However, they always need workers so that they can produce their bricks in less time.  Dina sells her products directly from her production site.  Thanks to her work, she managed to buy a vehicle for transporting her bricks to her customers.  This was done to minimize costs and time.

This is Dina's eighth loan from MFP and she pledges to continue making her repayments punctually and efficiently.  She feels happy with her community bank as a result of the benefits that it offers.  Dina will invest the 2,000 soles in her brick-making business, buying materials for it.

loans.use: to buy materials to make more bricks

loans.name: Reina Margarita

texts.es:
Reina, se dedica a vender ropa en los hogares, ella vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 22 y 25 años de edad, el negocio lo aprendió hace dos años hasta ahorita no ha presentado ningún problema, trabaja  todos los días de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más variedad de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros como: pantalones, camisas, faldas, blusas y de esa forma podrá tener más ingresos.
El sueño de Reina es mantener estable su negocio apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios que ellos tengan lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Reina makes a living selling clothing door to door.  She lives with her husband and two children who are 25- and 22-years old, respectively.  She started the business two short years ago and is satisfied with her progress.  
Reina will use this loan to buy clothing for men, women and children: trousers, shirts, skirts, blouses, etc.
Reina wants a steady income so that she can help her chldren get a good education.

loans.use: to stock her retail clothing business.

loans.name: Rachanath

texts.fr: Rachanath est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est distributrice de pagnes, bazins, bijoux et utensils de cuisine et le reste est étalé à son domicile. En vue de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un micro-crédit à Finadev afin d'accroître son stock de marchandises et de prendre en partie les charges familiales.
texts.en: Rachanath is a married mother of one. She is a distributor of pagnes (brightly printed West African clothing), jewels, and kitchen utensils, which are spread out at her home. In order to satisfy the needs of her clientele, she is seeking a micro-loan from Finadev to be able to increase her merchandise stock and to help pay for family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 40 pagnes (brightly printed West African clothing), 20 dozen plates, and miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Hector Daniel

texts.es: A sus 53 años, el señor Héctor Daniel se dedica desde hace 40 años a la labor de zapatero, gracias a su padre quien se dedica a esta misma actividad y le brindó todos los conocimientos necesarios para que tuviera su propio taller. La jornada de trabajo del señor Héctor Daniel es de lunes a sábado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m en compañía de su esposa e hija menor quienes le colaboran. Con el ánimo de mejorar sus ventas y con estas su calidad de vida, el señor Héctor Daniel necesita de la compra de insumos tales como pegas, suelas, telas y cuero con lo cual pueda fabricar nuevos estilos de zapatos para ofrecer a sus clientes. El sueño del señor Héctor Daniel es convertir su taller en una gran distribuidora de zapatos.
texts.en:
At 53 years of age, Sr. Héctor Daniel has been working as a shoemaker for 40 years. His father was in the same line of work and taught him everything he needed to know so that he could open his own workshop. Héctor Daniel works Monday through Saturday from 8am to 6pm. His wife and his young daughter assist him.

In order to improve his sales and his quality of life, Sr. Héctor Daniel needs to buy supplies such as adhesives, soles, fabrics, and leather so that he can make new styles of shoes that he can offer to his customers. His dream is to convert his workshop into a large shoe distribution warehouse.

loans.use: to buy adhesives, soles, fabrics, leather, and other supplies.

loans.name: Patricia Amada

texts.es: La señora Patricia a sus 39 años se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas y a la venta de helados. Anteriormente tenía un negocio al frente de un hospital reconocido de la ciudad de Medellín, pero por una enfermedad lo tuvo que dejar a un lado y posteriormente lo perdió. Ahora, con el acompañamiento de su mamá y un amigo ha empezado con la venta de helados y con la venta de comidas rápidas, actividad con la cual sostiene los gastos de su hogar y los de sus 4 hijos. Sueña con tener un espacio al lado de su carro de comidas rápidas más atractivo para los clientes, por lo que requiere de la compra de una carpa y de unas sillas para adecuarlo, además de la compra de insumos como salsas, carnes, desechables entre otros. Busca que su negocio crezca y se consolide en el sector, de modo que pueda obtener mayores ingresos y poder brindarle a sus hijos la educación que requieren y un futuro económico mas estable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Patricia, 39, earns a living selling fast food and ice cream.  She used to have a business across from a well-known hospital in the city of Medellín, but  because of illness was unable to attend to it and went out of business.  Now, with her mother and a friend helping out she sells ice cream and fast food.  The business provides an income to cover household expenses and support her four children.

Her dream is to set up a nicer area near her fast food stall to make it more attractive for customers.  She wants to fix it up with an awning and chairs, and buy supplies such as sauces, meats, and disposable products among other things.  She wants her business to grow and become stable in its sector so she can earn more income and giver her children a good education and a more secure future.

loans.use: To fix up her food stall with an awning and chairs, as well as buy supplies.

loans.name: Monique Ibidjoke

texts.fr: Monique est une femme mariée et n'a pas encore d'enfant. Coiffeuse de formation, elle y a associé la vente des mêches et de pagnes. Pour étendre son secteur d'activité et  satisfaire sa clientèle, elle fait recours à Finadev visant ainsi à atteindre son objetif en vue de maximiser son profit et de contribuer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en: Monique is a married woman who doesn’t have any children yet. Trained in hairstyling, she started selling hair extensions and pagnes (brightly printed West African clothing). To broaden her business and satisfy her clientele, she is seeking the help of Finadev in order to reach her goal of maximizing profits and to contribute to family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 50 hair extensions and 30 pagnes (brightly printed West African clothing).

loans.name: Maria Ercilia

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y francés, tiene dos hijos de 27 y 22 años de edad, ella lleva 5 años en el negocio, este surgió por iniciativa propia, este negocio lo atiende de 5:00am a 7:00pm.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pan dulce y francés, ya que ella lo obtiene de una panadería para poder venderlo a los clientes, esto le ayudara para mantener suficiente disponibilidad en el negocio.
La aspiración de María es apoyar a sus hijos incondicionalmente, para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Maria has been working selling sweet bread and French bread for five years. She started this business of her own accord, and she works from 5:00 AM to 7:00 PM.  She has two children, ages 27 and 22.

Maria is applying for this loan to buy sweet bread & French bread, which she gets from a bakery in order to sell it to her customers. This loan will help her to maintain sufficient liquid assets in her business. 

Maria's goal is to be able to support her children unconditionally so that they can succeed.

loans.use: to buy sweet bread and French bread.

loans.name: Marcelo Eduardo

texts.es:
Marcelo es un padre soltero que tiene 32 años. Vive con sus dos hijos de 7 y 9 años en una finca en "San Miguel de Los Bancos" que es un cantón que pertenece a la provincia de Pichincha (donde también se ubica la capital del Ecuador), toda la zona es visitada por sus cascadas, ríos y biodiversidad, el río Mulaute es un sitio de interés turístico, en varios tramos de estos ríos se practica el rafting. La comida típica es la guaña o campeche, que es un pescado que se consume estofado con plátano de tipo denominado orito verde. El ceviche de palmito, la tilapia, lomo a la piedra y el dulce de guayaba.

Marcelo ha cultivado la tierra toda su vida, ya que la finca donde vive era de sus padres y él ha vivido siempre en este sitio. Pero su actividad económica principal es la recolección de leche. El en un viejo camión recolecta litros de leche de los pequeños productores para luego ser entregados a una gran procesadora de productos lácteos. Los contenedores en los que pone la leche son especiales y costosos, todos los días cargarlos para subirlos a su camión es la tarea más difícil de su trabajo. Marcelo nos cuenta que si él pudiera recolectar más podría tener mayores ingresos ya que la planta procesadora tiene una gran demanda. Por este motivo Marcelo accederá a un crédito el cual le permitirá comprar más contenedores. 

Su preocupación es la educación de sus hijos que ha criado solo y por ellos todos los días trabaja muy duro. Marcelo espera poder pagar su alimento, su vestido y su educación.
texts.en:
Marcelo is a 32-year-old single father. He lives with his two children, ages 7 and 9, on a farm in San Miguel de Los Bancos, a Canton that belongs to Pichincha Province (where the capital of Ecuador is also located). The entire region receives visitors who come for its waterfalls, rivers, and biodiversity; the Mulaute River is a popular tourist destination, and in several branches of these rivers people come to go rafting. Traditional food from the region includes guaña, also called campeche, which is a fish that eaten stuffed with a type of plantain called "orito verde" ("little green gold"). Other foods include palm heart ceviche, tilaplia, steak served on a hot grill-like plate, and jelly made from guayaba.

Marcelo has worked on the land for all of his life. The farm where he lives belonged to his parents, and he has always lived there. His primary work, though, is collecting milk. In an old truck, he goes around picking up liters of milk from smaller producers to later deliver to a large plant that processes dairy products. The containers he uses to transport the milk are special and expensieve, and carrying them and lifting them into his truck every day is the most difficult part of his work. Marcelo tells us that if he could collect more, he would have better income, as the processing plant has a large demand. For this reason, Marcelo has applied for a loan, which would allow him to buy more containers.

Marcelo worries about his children's education, as he is raising them alone, and he works very hard for them every day. Marcelo hopes to be able to pay for their food, their clothing, and their education.

loans.use: to buy storage tanks for milk.

loans.name: Delphine Badoussi

texts.fr: Delphine est mariée avec cinq enfants à charge. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de divers, condiments, tapettes, charbons etc... à son domicile. Elle s'approvisionne presque dans tous les marchés de la place. Pour satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle, elle sollicite le renouvellement de son micro crédit auprès de Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra  d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et pour mieux contribuer au bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en: Delphine is married with five children in her care. She sells miscellaneous items, seasonings, flip flops, charcoal, etc. from her home. She stocks up at all the area markets. To satisfy the needs of her clientele, she is seeking to renew her micro-loan from Finadev. This loan will allow her to increase her business and to better contribute to the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of charcoal, 4 baskets of tomatoes, and miscellaneous items

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa, natural de la ciudad de Kimbiri de 37 años de edad es una mujer  trabajadora, está casada con Germán de 41 años y fruto de esa convivencia tuvieron 03 hijos a quienes desea brindarles una buena prosperidad. Elisa tiene conocimiento sobre la  actividad  que realiza; es por ello con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo, se dedico de lleno a la actividad agrícola, específicamente  al cultivo de cacao; hace 20 años que tiene conocimiento sobre el cultivo de cacao y desde luego que aprendió las buenas enseñanzas que lo dieron sus padres. Ella reconoce que su éxito abarca desde la calidad de su producto hasta que lleva a venderlos a los centros de acopio de su comunidad a precio competitivo, no obstante se queda contenta con lo logrado hasta el momento, por lo tanto ya tiene planeado ampliar su terreno de cultivo con la necesidad de minimizar costo y tiempo, en efecto obtener buenos resultados económicos. Usualmente recibe la ayuda de su esposo y juntos realizan su trabajo, además siempre tratan de mejorar nuevas técnicas de cuidado para sus plantaciones agrícolas, para ello están abocado en su chacra desde muy tempranas horas hasta el atardecer. Este es crédito numero 04 con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago de manera oportuna, además se siente fortalecida y seguro con su banco comunal. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprara fertilizantes para realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos, asi como sacar la mala hierba.
texts.en:
Elisa, a hard-working 37-year-old, is from the city of Kimbiri.  She is married to Germán, 41, and they have three children who they try to provide a good life for.  Elisa has expertise in agriculture and with much dedication and effort grows her cocoa crop.  She learned the trade from her parents and has been involved in this activity for 20 years.  She acknowledges the fact that the success of her crop is due to the quality of her produce and the competitive price she offers at the community center where she sells.  She is content with her achievements so far and is planning to expand her cropland while minimizing cost and time involved in an effort to obtain good economic results.

Normally her husband helps out with the work and together they are always searching for new techniques for plantation care.  They go out to work the fields from very early in the morning and are there until late in he evening.  This is her fourth loan through MFP, and she is committed to paying it back on time.  Her communal bank gives her a sense of strength and security.  With the 1,000 PEN loan she will buy fertilizers for crop maintenance and to kill the weeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Nicolasa Del Rosario

texts.es:
Nicolasa, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de tortillas, lo comenzó por iniciativa propia debido a la necesidad de darles lo mejor a su familia, trabaja todos los días debido a la demanda de sus clientes.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar maíz, leña, gas, bolsas, de esa forma podrá tener  la materia prima y obtener  mejores ingresos y cada día mejorar más la  atención a sus clientes.
El sueño de Nicolasa tener un negocio más grande en mejores condiciones seguir trabajando con nuestra institución y darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Nicolasa lives with her husband and their two children. She has worked selling tortillas for several years. She started this business through her own iniciative because of the necessity to give her family the best. Due to her customers' high demand, she works every day.

She will use this loan to buy corn, firewood, gas, and bags, and in this way, she will be able to have more primary materials and make better income, improving her service to her customers every day.

Nicolasa's dream is to have a bigger and better business, to continue working with the lending institution, and to give her family the best possible life.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, gas, and bags.

loans.name: Awoumessi

texts.fr:
Awoumessi est une femme âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariés å un plombier. Elle a 3 enfants.
Awoumessi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2000. Elle vend des poissons fumés et séchés pour tous clients dans un marché de la place. Elle achète les produits au Ghana. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficultés.
Awoumessi a requis son 2nd  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des poissons fumés et séchés. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Awoumessi voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awoumessi is a 54-year-old woman. She is married to a plumber and has three children.
Awoumessi has worked as a retailer since 2000. She sells smoked and dried fish to all types of customers at the market in her neighborhood. She buys her products in Ghana. She works by herself. Currently, she has no difficulties in her business.
Awoumessi has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy smoked and dried fish. She wants to reinvest in her business.
In the coming years, Awoumessi would like to expand the size of her business. She says that with the profits, she intends to take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.es: Marlon de 34 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanías con las cuales ha logrado apoyar el bienestar de su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 5 a 11 años. Su negocio lo inició en el año 2000,  aunque su experiencia como comerciante  la inició desde el año 1997. Su negocio es atendido por él y por su cónyuge,  desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde diariamente. Sus principales clientes son los peatones, trabajadores ubicados alrededor del negocio,  jóvenes interesados en calcomanías y con su competencia muy cerca a él,   genera clientes potenciales a su negocio. En la actualidad planea su crecimiento, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente,  para apoyar con nuevo surtido la mercancía que usualmente rota más rápido. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará hilos para tejer, acero, piedras, totumos y semillas, con las cuales fabricará diversos diseños de accesorios femeninos y masculinos, en los cuales ha trabajado para responder a sus compradores. La inversión resultará exitosa porque la hará en una época de gran movilidad comercial, en la cual hay mucha rotación de dinero, por efecto de las primas y bonificaciones de los empleados de empresas que son sus principales clientes.
texts.en:
Marlon is 34 years old. He works creating and selling artisanal crafts, a job that has allowed him to support the wellbeing of his family, made up of his partner and their three children between 5 and 11 years old. He began this business in the year 2000, but his experience in sales began in 1997. 

The craft business is tended by both Marcelo and his partner from 10:00 in the morning to 5:00 in the afternoon every day. Their main customers are pedestrians, workers who are located near the business, and young people who are interested in artistic decals. With competition close by his business, he is able to generate potential customers for his business. 

Marlon is currently planning to grow his business, but his working capital is not sufficient to support a new assortment of merchandise that rotates more often. He is applying for his first loan through Kiva, with which he will buy fibers for weaving, steel, stones, toturnos (a type of gourdlike fruit), and seeds, with which he will make different accessories for men and women that he has designed with his buyers' comments in mind. The investment will be successful, because he will be expanding at a time of great commercial mobility, in which there is a lot of moving around of money because of prizes and bonuses given to the the employees at nearby business, who are his principal clients.

loans.use: to purchase yarn for weaving, steel, stones, totumos, and seeds.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, vive con su esposa y sus hijos él tiene su negocio de granja de pollos, él lo inicio por iniciativa propia debido a la necesidad de tener más ingresos, no tiene un horario establecido.
El crédito lo necesita para  comprar más pollos para crecerlos y luego venderlos de esa forma podrá tener mejores ingresos.
El sueño de Miguel es tener una granja más grande y tener  clientela, con su familia espera darle lo necesario.
texts.en:
Miguel lives with his wife and children. He has a poultry business, which he started himself due to the necessity of increasing his income. He doesn't have a fixed schedule.

Miguel is applying for this loan to buy more chickens to raise, and later sell them; in this way, he will be able to make a better income.

Miguels' dream is to have a larger poultry farm and more customers, and to be able to provide for his family's necessities.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Mireille Noudéhouénou

texts.fr: Mireille, responsable du groupe de deux personnes,vit maritalement avec deux enfants dont une domestique. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de produits congelés, lapins, ailerons et divers dans une boutique  de sa localité. Pour se ravitailler, elle se rend dans les poissonneries de la place. Dans le but de répondre aux préoccupations de sa clientèle, elle fait donc recours au financement de Finadev. Le bénéfice engendré lui permettra de renforcer son fonds de commerce et de contribuer en partie aux charges du foyer.
