Norlyn is married with 2 children. She is 39 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.
Norlyn owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 6 years. Each month, she earns 5000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 25000 PHP to purchase more stock to sell.
Norlyn has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Norlyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mrs. Mean is 46 years old and a mother of three single children living in Prey Chor district. Agriculture is the sole source of her income because this couple is extremely dependant on the output of the rice they produce.  As shown, the photo of Mean was taken with her husband in their new house, which she just bought from a local villager. Due to the lack of capital, Mean still is in debt to the previous house owner. Thus, she has applied for a loan from HKL to pay off her debt to the owner. Mean is very happy for the loan given to her. She said that she’ll pay her loan back to our MFI regularly on time as she did with her previous loans.

loans.use: to pay off her debt to the previous house owner.

loans.name: Ut

texts.en: Mrs. Ut is 28 years old and lives in Prey Chor district with her husband and two school-aged children. She grows rice crops for her livelihood and her husband works as a construction worker from place to place around the country. She is a responsible mother who always takes time to educate her children to be good people at home. Currently, Ut’s husband has faced difficulty with transportation due to the lack of a family-owned vehicle. And he has more expenses for motor-taxi fees to get to his workplace. It would be better if her family owned a motorcycle. So now, Ut wants to acquire her first loan from Kiva to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband to use to commute to his workplace. In the future, Ut plans to rebuild her house and make it comfortable for living.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband.

loans.name: Silia

texts.en:
Silia is 25 years of age and single with one child. 

Silia owns & operates a business baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business.  Silia needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase additional ingredients to increase production. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Silia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Silia's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en: Mrs. Ruos lives in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham. She grows rice crops along with her husband throughout the year. She is now 39 years old and is blessed with 4 single children. One of her son works as a labourer in Thailand and her daughter works as a labourer on a plantation in other province. After the rice farming has been completed, Ruos won’t allow her time to pass by without any advantages. She wishes to generate more income during her spare time. Therefore, she would like to ask for some funds from Kiva, through HKL to buy potatoes in bulk from a villager's plantation to stock for future sale. Then, she’ll sell them at a profitable price to tradesmen or directly to vendors. Ruos hopes that she’ll be able to own a potato plantation herself in the commune someday.

loans.use: to buy potatoes in bulk for future sale

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s wholesales business. He sells edible items like chocolates, candies, and chips to different grocery stores for a profit. He has good contacts to whom he sells his items through orders. With the loan investment, he will buy these items in larger quantities and improve his sales. 

Nasreen herself is a housewife. She spends her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She has given birth to 2 sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their educations. She is very confident that the loan investment will help her family to live a better financial life. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Nasreen.”

loans.use: to buy edible items for selling

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is 36-years-old and is married with two children. He is a firewood seller and has been in the business for the last four years. He gets a monthly profit of about KES 10,000.

The client was introduced to KADET ltd by a credit officer and he is applying for his first loan of Kes 30,000 which he plans to use to add more stock of firewood for selling. The client will save the anticipated profit as he continues to support his family. 

In future, Mathew hopes to grow his business and have his own fired wood depot and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fire wood stock for sale.

loans.name: Fariza's Group

texts.en:
Fariza has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s agriculture business. With the loan investment, he will buy seeds and fertilizers for growing different crops and he will earn more profits from his business.

Fariza is an embroidery and sewing expert and works for her neighboring clients. She is very artistic in her work and receives a good number of orders every month.

She has given birth to six children. Three of them work in a factory while the remaining three are studying.

She is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well.

Her husband has been operating his business for the past many years and Fariza is hopeful that an investment will help him make his business more profitable.

Note:"In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Fariza."

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for an agriculture business.

loans.name: Fedinand

texts.en:
Fedinand is 34-years-old, married and a father of two children. He operates an electronic and battery shop and has been in the business for the last three years. He earns a monthly income of about Kes 25,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his first loan of Kes 30,000. Ferdinand plans to buy working tools such as screw driver kits, electric chargers, and other tools that he may need to conduct his business. He plans to save the anticipated profit as he continues to support his family and educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to own an electronics distribution store and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more working tools/equipment for his business.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Amani Ilela Group

texts.en:
Dastan is a 44 year-old father of six children and three are attending secondary education. He is hardworking and has been producing maize, beans, cassava and coffee for over 26 years. He faces farming problems due to a lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Dastan is looking for working capital in order to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. In the next five years, he wishes to improve his scale of production from 10 to 21 acres which can lead to more income which can repair his family home, pay for school fees and cover medical expenses.

The Amani Ilela group had five members but two of them have passed away. Currently there are only three members.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock of poultry.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 24-years-old. She operates a second-hand clothes business and has been in the business for the last two years. She earns a monthly profit of Kes 12,000.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She is applying for her second loan of Kes 60,000 which she intends to use to add additional stock of trousers, blouses and skirts. The client will save the anticipated profits with the view of expanding her business.

In future, Lydia hopes to grow her business and turn it into a full boutique while also striving to venture into other investments.

loans.use: to add more stock of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Changawa

texts.en:
Changawa is 36-years-old, married and has six children. He has been operating a grocery business for the last two years earning a monthly profit of Kes 10,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and he is applying for his first loan of Kes 20,000 which he plans to use to buy stocks of kale, maize, beans, onions and tomatoes. The client will save the anticipated profit as he continues to support his family. 

In future, Changawa hopes to grow his business and open a retail/wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy stocks of onions and tomotoes.

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is 37, married and lives with her husband and four children. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.
 
Azra herself is a social worker. She teaches women of her community about their health. Woman of her community come to her for discussing health issues.  

Her husband is a vegetable vendor. He specifically sells potatoes and onions. These two products are in great demand. He makes good sales every month by visiting different areas on his four-wheeled cart. He has been operating his business for more than five years.
 
With this loan, her husband will purchase potato and onion sacks in larger quantity for increasing his sales and profits. 

She is confident that her husband’s income will be increased further after the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Azra.

loans.use: To buy potato and onion sacks for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Yaseen

texts.en: Yaseen who is a 27-year-old young man, is married with no children yet. He is a school teacher with a decent salary that is not sufficient to pay all the daily life expenses throughout the month. Yaseen lives with his wife in an old house and wants to make some necessary repairs to it such as: painting, changing windows and doors, etc. He also wants to purchase some necessary home furniture such as: living room seats, kitchen table, etc., instead of his old ones, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Yaseen gets the loan, he will be able to pay for doing all the necessary repairs to his house and to purchase new home furniture, which will enable Yaseen to live with his wife in better and more comfortable house conditions. Yaseen is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to repair his house and purchase necessary home furniture.

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat is 27 years of age. She is married and has no child yet and lives in her father’s home.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the improvement of her brother’s livestock business. With the loan investment, he will buy another buffalo that will allow him to get a larger quantity of milk and increase his sales and profits.

He is new in his business and Farhat is hopeful that an investment will help him earn higher profits and get more established in his business.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Farhat.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her livestock business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like wheat flour and maize flour to stock his shop.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en: Nune lives in Yerevan with her husband and son who is a student. Nune has opened a little grocery this year to have a stable source of income. Nune has applied for this loan to develop her business. With the loan's help she plans to purchase goods for her shop. This loan will help Nune to continue successfully running the shop and make the business more profitable. Nune will get more income and ensure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventory.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru: Муродджон умный и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Он женат. Более 5 лет занимается предоставлением услуги грузового такси. Он начал свой бизнес с помощью отца. Его отец купил ему легковой автомобиль, а он занимался перевозкой пассажиров по городу. Постепенно через 2 года он накопил деньги и купил себе Грузовой автомобиль «Зил». Каждый день с утра он уезжает на работу. У него много постоянных клиентов. Муродджон хотел бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки шин для грузового автомобиля в зимний период.
texts.en: Murodjon is an intelligent and hard-working young man. He is married. For over five years, he has run a goods delivery service. His father helped him to start his business. His father bought him a car to use as a taxi around the city. Gradually, over two years, he saved enough money to buy a Zil brand truck. Every day, he leaves for work in the morning. He has many regular clients. Murodjon would like a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy tires for his truck for the winter season.

loans.use: To purchase tires for his truck

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun was taken a photograph with her husband at her house, which is located in Prey Chor district. She is 42 years old and has 5 children, one of whom is already married and lives away from home. Chhun generates her income by growing annual rice crops on her inherited farmland. However, the output is rarely enough to satisfy the whole family. To help the difficult situation, two of her daughters decided to work as sewing staff in a garment factory in Phnom Penh and send a part of their monthly salary home to help their parents.

In the coming months, one of Chhun’s children is going to get married, thus, Chhun will take responsibilities to manage the party. Consequently, Chhun would like to ask for some funds to prepare the wedding party of her child, which will come soon. She is very happy and grateful to all lenders who kindly help her family.

loans.use: to prepare the wedding party of her child.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 24-year-old young man. He is married with one son and one daughter. He is a worker with low income. Mohammad wants to offer his family comfortable living room seats, but since his income isn't enough to pay for this purchase, he needs to take a loan from FATEN. Getting this loan will enable Mohammad to purchase living room seats and create for his family better living conditions in their house. Mohammad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase living room seats.

loans.name: Oiniso

texts.ru: Оинисо разведенная женщина и на  воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 3 лет она занимается торговлей на центральном рынке. Она продает женские и детские одежды. Она имеет хороший опыт и успешна в своем деле. Оиннисо хотела бы получить займ в размере 4000 Сомони для покупки нового ассортимента одежды с целью увлечения оборотного капитала и расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Oiniso is a divorced woman, who is raising two children.  She has been involved in sales at the central market for over three years.  She sells women's and children's clothing.  She has a good experience and is successful in her business.  Oiniso wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 4000 Somoni to purchase a new selection of clothing in order to increase working capital and expand her business.  She relies on your support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in order to expand her business

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Jitahidi Ilela Group

texts.en:
Anna is a 31-year-old married woman with two children, one attending secondary education. She has been growing maize, beans and coffee for over 10 years. She is earning low income in crop production due to crop diseases and a lack of fertilizers.

Anna would like to find working capital to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. She would also like to expand the scale of production in the next five years from 5 to 13 acres with the expectation of earning more income that can be utilized to purchase clothes, build a better house and cover medical expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun (pictured here) and her husband, Chhoeun, have been married since 1989 and have two sons and two daughters. The family lives across the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Yun is a rice farmer, while her husband is a fisherman. Yun sells fish caught by her husband. In addition, when is not in fishing season, Chhoeun is also a chef. He cooks for wedding, ceremonies and other occasions.

Yun is requesting a loan of $1,100 to buy a motorcycle for commuting.      

Photo: Yun is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim, 46, is a humble resident who lives in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Agriculture is the main part of her life and is her sole of income. She is married with 5 children, some of whom are now working to help the family.

Sim wants to borrow some funds from Kiva’s lenders to buy stocks of rice at a low price during harvesting season. And then she hopes to sell them in a profitable price when the market of rice increases its demand. With the generated income from the business, she’ll use it to buy additional farmland in order to increase the output of rice.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice for future sale.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman with 4 children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol, with her family.

She runs a sari-sari store business where she sells items like canned goods, coffee and sugar. She also sells fresh and dried fish to her community. She works hard to provide for her family's needs and to send her children to school.

Leonila has requested this loan to buy more items and fish to sell. She hopes to have a progressive business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sopheab

texts.en:
Sopheab (in the photo), aged 32, is a weaver and she is also a vegetable farmer. She has been married since 2004 and has two young children and has just now given birth to one more baby. Her husband, Vansy, aged 42, is a motor taxi driver. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sopheab is requesting her first loan of $600 to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for her vegetable farm and to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for her vegetable farm and to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Sophan (in the photo), aged 36, and her husband, Hai, aged 42, live in a village about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1994 and have one son and two daughters: two attend school and the third is still too young.  

Sophan and her husband are farmers. They grow longans (a tropical fruit) and flowers. They also buy some flowers under contract from their fellow villagers and sell them to a middleman who comes to buy them at their home.  

Sophan is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase additional flowers for resale.

loans.use: To buy additional flowers for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 47-year-old married woman with 5 children. Her husband is a farmer.

Victoria has had a sari-sari store business for 15 years. She sells items like canned goods, soap, shampoo, vinegar and cooking oil. She also helps her husband grow rice crops on their land. She does her best to support her family.

She has requested this loan to buy fertilizers as well as more items to sell, such as canned goods, sugar and coffee. Victoria hopes to have a stable income to help sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers as well as more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina is a 39-year-old entrepreneur form Yerevan. She runs a little shop where she sells food. Irina would like to increase her sales and develop her business. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase some more inventory for the shop. This loan will help Irina to increase the business income and expand her shop in the future.

loans.use: to pay for inventory for her shop

loans.name: Bonfice

texts.en:
Bonfice is 26 years old, married to Elizabeth, and they have two children. He has been operating a quarry business for the last 6 years with a monthly income of about Kes 15,000.

He is requesting his second loan with KADET of Kes 40,000 to expand his quarry output by buying more equipment for quarrying tools; i.e. cold chisels and hammers. With the anticipated profits he plans to become a wholesaler of construction stones.

His hopes and dreams are to buy a lorry to directly transport the quarry products to his customers.

loans.use: to expand his quarry business.

loans.name: Thim

texts.en:
Thim, aged 36, is in the business of raising pigs from which she is able to earn approximately $1.50 per day. Currently, she lives in Baray district with her husband and two school-aged children. 

Thim has requested this loan from HKL and Kiva to buy posts which will be used to build a fence around her house. This fence will secure the family from unexpected things happening. In the future, Thim wants to own a general store selling mixed products from her house.

loans.use: to buy posts which will be used to build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Celestina is a married woman with 7 children. She is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She tills her own land to grow rice crops to sell. Aside from farming, she also buys and sells vegetables in her community. She works hard to support her family. Celestina has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies. She hopes to earn better and be able to improve their house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey, aged 53, lives in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a widowed mother with five sons and one daughter. Three of her children are married and live outside the family home, one has full-time employment and another one is in school.   

Srey is a weaver and raises pigs at home. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to purchase pig feed and additional pigs to raise.

Photo: Srey at work weaving.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Sitha is a weaver, while her husband, Det, is a house builder. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have two married daughters. One daughter lives in a separated home and the other one still lives in the family home. 

Sitha has asked for Kiva loans several times. She is now asking for a new loan of $300 to support her weaving business by allowing her to purchase weaving materials.  Weaving is a traditional profession.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima lives in Yeghegnavan village with her husband. The couple earns a living by cultivating their rented land. Rima has applied for a loan in order to cultivate the land; she plans to purchase watermelon seeds. Rima hopes to get a good harvest in the spring and earn additional income from the sales.

loans.use: to pay for watermelon seeds.

loans.name: Sereyny

texts.en:
Sereyny (pictured here) is 41 years old and her husband, Sokhan, is 52 years old. They live in a village outside of Phnom Penh City. They have two sons and one daughter; two are in school and one is still young. 

Sereyny is a high school teacher. Her husband is a musician and also operates a business renting out sets of musical instruments to villagers in his village and the nearby province. 

One particular set of musical instruments is usually called Ork Kes in Khmer. The people in the countryside prefer to rent Ork Kes to entertain in weddings, some religious ceremonies, and especially before and during Khmer New Year. Most people rent Karaoke to sing and dance both in the pagoda and inside their houses, and now there are lots of weddings and religious ceremonies.

Sereyny is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to assist in her husband’s musician business by buying a piano and materials needed for his business.

loans.use: To buy a piano and materials needed for her husband’s business as a musician.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is 46 years old. She is married and has two children. Her son has a vegetable-selling business, and her daughter is an embroidery expert. 

Allah Rakhi also does work. She is a sewing expert and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She has great interest in her work. She tries to learn new things in sewing and sews good-looking clothes at reasonable rates. 

Allah Rakhi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who operates a grocery store business. With the loan investment, he will buy grocery stock such as spices, sugar, cooking oil, etc. in bulk quantity, which will allow him to fulfill client orders on time and increase his profits. 

Allah Rakhi has a lot of confidence in her husband.  She believes he will make good use of the loan money and earn good profits as a result.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock for her husband's grocery store business.

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Saroeurn (pictured above), 25, and his wife, Samoeun, 24, live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2008 and have one young daughter.  

Saroeurn produces jars for sale. His wife is a hired farmer who gets paid a wage. Saroeurn is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy a remoque to carry his jars for sale. He will also use a part of the loan to purchase materials needed in his business. 

A remoque, as it is called by Cambodian people, is a motorbike with a trailer attached at the back.

loans.use: To buy a remoque (motorbike with a trailer) to carry his jars for sale.

loans.name: Sreymich

texts.en:
Sreymich (in the photo), 27, and her husband, Pheap, 31, live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have two daughters; one is in school and the other is still young.  

Sreymich and her husband are garment workers. Sreymich is asking for her first loan in the amount of $600 to assist in her grandparents’ farming business by buying seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and a water pumping machine. Sreymich’s grandparents are still strong enough to work.

loans.use: To assist in her grandparents’ farming business by buying seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and a water pumping machine.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 54 years old. She lives with her husband, son, and daughter. Emma has been engaged in farming for nine years: she keeps a greenhouse. Emma has applied for a loan to cultivate the land and develop her greenhouse. With the help of the loan, she plans to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel. This development of her farming will allow Emma to increase her income and insure a higher living standard for her family.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, and fuel.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen (in the photo) and her husband, Chann, live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one daughter who is in school. 

Yen sells Khmer noodles; she buys Khmer noodles from her village and transports them to sell in other villages. Her husband assists his wife in the business. Yen is asking for a loan of $500 to buy the neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.use: To buy the neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.name: Callistus

texts.en:
Callistus is 50 years old, married, and a father of four children. He is a livestock farmer and has been in the business for the last three years, earning a monthly income of about Kes 25,000. 

He was introduced to KADET ltd by a credit officer. He is applying for his first loan of Kes 12,000, with which he plans to buy additional livestock such as goats and ducks. The client will save the anticipated profit as he continues to support his family.

 In the future, this gentleman hopes to grow his business into large scale farming.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock.

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia is 28 years old, married, and a mother of five children. She has been selling fish for the last three years, earning a monthly income of about Kes 9,000. 

The client was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She is applying for her first loan of Kes 20,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy an additional stock of fish to sell. The client will save the anticipated profit to help pay school fees for her children.

 In future, she hopes to grow her business and own a fish depot in the locality.

loans.use: To buy an additional stock of fish.

loans.name: Haykush

texts.en: Haykush lives with her husband and daughter. The main source of the family's income is farming. Haykush keeps an orchard where she grows different kinds of trees. She has applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer, which will allow her to grow the trees successfully and to get a good harvest, meeting the demand for fruit in the community and in neighbouring cities.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer

loans.name: Kiwambicha Huruma Kikuli Group

texts.en:
Fulko is a 28-year-old father of four children with two children attending secondary education. He has been growing maize, coffee and beans for over 20 years. His farming problems are a lack of fertilizers and insecticides.

Fulko is borrowing funds to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. He dreams to expand crop production in five years from 6 to 14 acres, which will lead to more income.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, insecticides and gum boots.

loans.name: Eugénie

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Eugénie vit dans la maison familiale. Elle est vendeuse de divers, riz, tissus et autres. En vue de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante, elle fait recours à Finadev pour l'obtention de prêt visant donc à accroître son stock. La marge bénéficière lui permettra de contribuer aux dépenses de son foyer et de scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Eugénie, who is married and mother to three children, lives in the family home. She sells rice, fabrics and other items. With a view to satisfying ever-increasing customer demand, she has resorted to Finadev to get a loan so that she can increase her stock. Her profit margin will allow her to contribute to the household expenses and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy 10 "pagnes" (a mixture of different types), 10 1kg bags of rice, 15 packets of sugar and other items

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is 28 years old, married, and a father of one child. He sells used clothes and has been in the business for the last year with a monthly profit of approximately KES 30,000.

He was introduced to KADET ltd by a credit officer, and he is applying for his second loan of Kes 60,000, with which he plans to purchase skirts, trousers, blouses and bed sheets. He will save the anticipated profit to buy a plot of land.

In the future Peterson hopes to grow his business into being a secondhand clothes distributor.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of used clothes.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 44 years old and married. For the last three years he has operated a retail stall, selling household utensils like cups, bowls, buckets and glasses, earning a monthly income of about Kes 30,000.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his second loan of Kes 60,000, with which he plans to buy a stock of sufurias (cooking pots), cups, plates, bowls and spoons. The client will save the anticipated profit and continue taking care of his family. 

In the future, Charles hopes to grow his business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy a stock of utensils to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 10 bags of corn, 2 boxes of milk and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and raw materials.

loans.name: Florentine Odile's Group

texts.fr: Responsable du groupe de deux personnes, Florentine vit avec son mari et a deux enfants. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente de divers, cartes de recharge, oeuf et de l'eau glacée. Elle exerce ses activités sur fonds propres et s'approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Dans l'objectif de diversifier son  activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus accrue, elle a sollicité et obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Par conséquent, elle vise à maximiser ses intérêts et  à contribuer aux charges de son foyer.
texts.en:
Florentine is responsible for this two-person group. She lives with her husband and has two children. She specialized in selling various products, such as phone recharge cards, eggs, and iced water.

She runs her business on her own capital and gets her supplies from the neighboring markets. In order to diversify her business and meet an ever increasing customer demand, she sought and obtained a loan from Kiva's partner, Finadev.

Her goals is to maximize her interests and help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 8 trays of eggs, 15 bags of sugar, and phone recharge cards

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
Shireen is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed next to the old stove he has in the stall. 

Shireen. who is a 32-year-old young woman, is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He also has a food stall in order to improve his income. Shireen wants to help her husband by getting a $2,000 loan from FATEN to purchase new stoves to be used for cooking food and also to purchase bulk ingredients such as chick peas, flour, etc, since her husband's decent salary isn't enough to cover all these purchases. 

When Shireen gets the loan, she will be able to help her husband to expand and improve his stall which has a large number of loyal customers who come daily to eat. This will improve the quality of food he makes and increase his sales which means an increase in his income which will enable Shireen to create better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To purchase stoves and bulk ingredients

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 48 years old. He is a father of five children. He has been operating a local cafe for the past three years, earning a monthly income of 27,000 KES. 

Daniel was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He is applying for a second loan of 50,000 KES, which he plans to use to buy a stock of serving plates, tea cups, teaspoons and food (such as potatoes, onions, wheat flour, etc.), which he would use in his business. Daniel will use the anticipated profit to help pay the school fees for his children. 

In the future, Daniel hopes to grow his business and own a well-established hotel.

loans.use: To buy a stock of food and utensils for his cafe.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 50 years old. She is married and has three children. 

To earn a living, Jane farms. She has been farming for more than 20 years. She practices mixed farming. She has employed two people to help her in her tasks.

Jane has improved her farming because of the financial support from Faulu Kenya. She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Jwan

texts.en:
Jwan is 35 years old and a proud mother of four children. She is also a proud and successful Iraqi working woman. For the past three years, she has been working hard in her beauty salon. Her clients are very pleased with the service they receive. 

Jwan is requesting a loan of $2,400 from Relief International-Iraq to make some changes to her salon and improve the working area, which will allow her to hire an employee to work with her in the salon.

loans.use: to improve her salon and create a working area for a potential employee.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is 47 years old. He and his wife, Cecilia, have five children. He has been in the tailoring business for the last 15 years, sewing clothes for his clients, from which he earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Onesmus is applying for his third loan of 20,000 KES. He paid his previous loans well and on time. He hopes to use the funds to buy an embroidery sewing machine and sewing materials. He plans to use the anticipated profits to open up another tailoring shop.

Onesmus' dream is to own a large clothing store and supply clothes to other towns.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine and sewing materials.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 26 years old and is married to Daniel.  They support five people within the family.

Dorcas has been operating an M-pesa outlet (mobile phone money transfer service), depositing and withdrawing money for clients for the last two years earning a monthly income of KES 70,000.  She is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000.  She plans to use the profits to provide the family with basic needs. 

Her hopes and is to expand her business and open another M-pesa outlet in future.

loans.use: To add extra cash float for withdrawal by M-pesa customers (mobile money transfer).

loans.name: Alexandrine Bernadette's Group

texts.fr: Bernadette, responsable du groupe de deux peronnes, vit maritalement et n'a pas encore d'enfant. Elle est couturière de profession et revend des pagnes au domicile des parents. Ses approvisionnements se font selon la zone favorable. Pour accroître son chiffre d' affaire et maximiser son profit , elle compte  renouveller  son micro crédit à Finadev afin d'honorer ses engagements vis-à-vis de ses clients  et de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Bernadette is responsible for this two-person group. She's married but doesn't have children yet. She's a professional seamstress and she resells pagnes (colorful African cloth) at her parent's home.

She gets her supplies from adequate areas. To increase her revenue and maximize her profit, she intends to renew her loan from Kiva's partner, Finadev, in order to fulfill her commitments towards her customers, and help with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 10 pagnes (colorful African cloth), one sewing machines, and threads

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a businessman who runs a motorbike transport business to earn a living.  He also owns an electronic shop.  He used his previous loan to start a business of selling plastic containers.  Besides that, he does dairy farming.

John has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow for dairy farming.

loans.name: Eliane Adjoua's Group

texts.fr: Agée de 27ans, Eliane est responsable du groupe de deux personnes. Mariée et mère d'un enfant, elle vend de divers articles pour bébé dans une boutique au bord des pavés. Son approvisionnement se fait dans les  marchés chez des grossistes. Pour  faire face à la demande de cette clientèle qui ne cesse de s'accroître, elle a sollicité et obtenu un micro-crédit à Finadev. Eliane vise à maximiser ses intérêts et à supporter en partie les dépenses de son foyer.
texts.en:
Eliane, age 27, is responsible for this two-person group. She's married and the mother of one child, and sells various baby products in a shop on the side of the street.

She gets her supplies from wholesalers at markets. To meet an ever-increasing customer demand, she sought and obtained a loan from Kiva's partner, Finadev.

Eliane's goal is to maximize her interests and pay for part of the expenses of her household.

loans.use: to buy 20 diapers and 20 pairs of socks

loans.name: Munguti

texts.en:
Munguti is 42 years old and is married to Mary.  They have three children.  He has been operating his butcher's shop for the last five years selling goat and sheep meat and earning a monthly income of KES 7,000.

He is applying for his third loan of KES 30,000, which he will use to buy more goats and sheep for slaughter.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.  He plans to save his profits to open up another butcher's shop.

His hopes and dreams are to start a hotel business and to educate his children to college level.

loans.use: To buy more goats and sheep to be slaughtered for sale in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 33-year-old mother of two. She has a degree in business and economics and ample knowledge to create a successful small business. Iman decided to tackle her family’s economic stability and purchased a local bookstore. The 15-year-old bookstore was slated to close until Iman stepped in to not only revitalize the store but fortify her family. In order to make the store profitable, Iman decided to diversify its stock and introduce additional book types, gifts and toys.

Iman needed this loan to restock her bookstore and expand its product range.

In the future Iman wants to overcome the seasonality of her bookstore by expanding with products that will draw customers throughout the year.

loans.use: To restock her bookstore and expand its product range.

loans.name: Josiane Yollande's Group

texts.fr: Responsable du groupe de deux personnes, Josiane vit avec son mari et a deux enfants. Elle est commerçante et a pour activité la vente de divers, mêches, cosmétiques et recharges au domicile de sa mère. Soucieuse de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité et obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev visant à maximiser ses intérêts, renforcer son fonds de commerce et à scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Josiane is responsible for this two-person group. She lives with her husband and has two children. She's a merchant who sells various items, such as hair extensions, cosmetics, and refills, at her mother's home.

Eager to meet customer demand, she sought and obtained a loan from Kiva's partner, Finadev, in order to maximize her interests, bolster her working capital, and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy 50 pieces of hair extension and 20 cosmetic products

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is 40 years old, married to Veronica and they have four children.  He has been in the dairy farming business for the last seven years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 5,000.

He is applying for his third loan with KADET Ltd for KES 20,000 to buy dairy feed, pesticides and seedlings. He plans to save the profits to buy a large water pump.


His hopes and dreams are to purchase another farming plot and to help educate his children.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, dairy feed and pesticides.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 47 years old, married and has nine children.  To earn a living, he runs a cafeteria.  He has been in the business for eleven years.  He has employed ten people in his business.  He also practices livestock farming for extra income.

Peter has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow to add to his livestock.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is 49 years old, married and has five children.  To earn a living, she runs a greengrocery.  She has been in the business for three years. Besides, she is also employed.  Since she became a member of Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business.

Consolata has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy kale, tomatoes, onions, carrots and peas.

loans.use: To buy kale, tomatoes, onions, carrots and peas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair braids, hair treatment and weaves

loans.name: Chrispine

texts.en:
Chrispine is 45 years old and married to Perpetua.  They have six children.  He has been into the tailoring business for the last thirteen years, earning a monthly income of KES 18,200.

He is applying for his fifth loan with KADET Ltd of KES 30,000 to buy sewing materials i.e. clothing textiles and sewing accessories.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the profits to buy more clothing materials for sewing, earning enough money to provide for his family's basic needs and to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Ramia

texts.en:
Ramia is a 25-year-old Lebanese woman.  She’s single, living with her parents and four siblings one of whom is still studying and the three others are working.  

In addition to her father, their main income provider, and her siblings, Ramia is working hard and supporting them to be able to enhance their way of living. She decided to start her own home business as a hair-dresser in 2006. She works with high professionalism and knows very well how to satisfy her clients. 

Today, she’s looking to borrow $1,600 from Kiva Partner Ameen S.A.L. to buy more hair-dressing tools and cosmetic products.  In that way, she will develop her work and attract added customers.  In the future, she plans to open her own hair-dressing salon.

loans.use: to buy more hair-dressing tools and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина замужем. Ее супруга зовут Юрий. У них двое детей. Валентина имеет собственный бизнес.
Валентина занимается фермерством на протяжении 20 лет.  Она выращивает ранние овощи. У Валентины две большие теплицы и хороший участок. Она надежная и трудолюбивая. В будущем она планирует  развивать свой бизнес. 

Валентина просит предоставить ей кредит на сумму 10000 гривен на закупку семян и угля. В этом году ее дочь поступила учиться в другой город, и Валентина ей помогает деньгами.
texts.en: Valentina is married, and her husband's name is Yuriy.  They have two children.  Valentina has her own business.  She has been involved in farming for 20 years and grows early vegetables.  Valentina has two large greenhouses and a good plot of land.  She is a reliable and hardworking person.  In the future, she plans to develop this business further.  Valentina is requesting a loan in the sum of 10,000 hryvnia to purchase seeds and coal.  Her daughter was accepted to study in another city this year, and Valentina helps her financially.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for sowing and coal for heating greenhouses

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 43 years old, married to Harrison and they have two children. She has been in the construction business, building rental houses, for the last 20 years, from which she earns a monthly income of KES 49,000.

She is applying for her fifth loan with KADET of KES 100,000.  She will use the loan to buy cement, iron sheets, timber and building blocks.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.  She plans to use the profits to renovate her already built houses.

Her hopes and dreams are to build more rental houses and to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy building materials and complete building ongoing rental houses.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила замужем. Ее супругу зовут Михаил.  У них трое детей. Людмила имеет свой бизнес.

Людмила выращивает ранние овощи. Этим делом она занимается на протяжении 15 лет. Людмиле нравится это направление. Она целеустремленная и трудолюбивая, живая и предприимчивая.  Этот бизнес содержит ее семью.

Людмила просит предоставить ей кредит на сумму 15,000 гривен на закупку семян, пленки, дров и на ремонт теплицы. Кредит поможет ей увеличить прибыль и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Ludmila is married.  Her husband's name is Mikhail, and they have three children.  Ludmila has her own business.  She grows early vegetables and has been involved in this business for 15 years.  Ludmila likes this business focus.  She is a goal-oriented and hardworking, lively and entrepreneurial.  This business supports her family.  Ludmila is requesting a loan in the sum of 15,000 hryvnia to purchase seeds, plastic, wood, and to repair a greenhouse.  This loan would help her to increase her profit and improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, plastic, wood and materials to repair a greenhouse

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is from the village of Ianeti, West Georgia. She is 31 years old and lives with her family:  Vakhtang and her mother-in-law. Vakhtang works as a truck driver and earns 200 Laris per month. Natalia is leading the agricultural business of the family. In particular, the family has a small dairy farm with two milk cows. She produces and sells on average 30kg of cheese per month. The family has two pigs and sells on average 12 piglets at the local market. Along with the above-mentioned businesses, the family has a greenhouse where greens and tomatoes are grown. The family sells harvested products at the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris.

Natalia requested a loan for the construction of a new greenhouse. With two greenhouses, she will be able to double the amount of grown and sold greens and tomatoes. This will increase the income of the family.  The income will be used for purchasing additional household goods to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse construction

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 49 years old. He lives in the village of Shilda (East Georgia) with his family: wife Nino and his 70 year old mother. The family earns their living through agricultural activities. In particular, the family has 2 milk cows and 40 sheep. Gela and Nino produce cheese and sell it to local dairy products retailers. Also, they sell lambs at the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris. 

Gela has requested credit for purchasing 7-8 calves. He will grow them in order to have more milking cows. He will be able to produce and sell more cheese. This will increase the income of the family. 

Gela plans to save proceeds from the increased income towards the renovation of the house. This will improve the family members’ living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves for expansion of the dairy farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy provision items such as luncheon meat, sardines, ovaltine, butter and assorted drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase computer accessories and pay for maintenance to his current computers.

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is from the village of Ruispiri, East Georgia. He is 56 years old and lives alone in the house. Nodar earns his living through trade of maize. He purchases maize in West Georgia and sells it at the local market. He also has a small poultry farm/incubator. He sells chickens to the neighborhood poultry farms. His total average monthly income is 900 Laris. Nodar has requested credit for purchasing additional maize for resale. 

In the future, Nodar plans to expand his poultry business to make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase maize for resale.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael, age 41, lives with his wife Irene in the village of Chabinaani in East Georgia. Michael works as a tin-smith and operates his own workshop. He fills orders from customers in his own village and from those nearby. Irene works as a teacher in the village. The average monthly income of the family is 635 Laris. 

Michael has requested credit for purchasing additional spare parts for his tin-smith plant. After adding the new parts, he is confident that the plant will be able to perform more operations. It will allow Michael to diversify the services he provides to customers. Accordingly, the family income will increase. 

Michael plans to reinvest part of the increased income into further development of his workshop. He wants eventually to purchase an additional plant. He will also apply some of his profits toward improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his tin-smith workshop

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en: Knarik lives with her husband and children. She keeps an orchard and cultivates land. Knarik has applied for a loan to improve her orchard. She will use the loan to purchase wire and columns to protect the orchard and fertilizer for it. Improvement of the orchard will allow Knarik to grow trees, cultivate the land more effectively, and increase her harvest.

loans.use: to pay for wire, columns and fertilizer for her orchard.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make some necessary repairs to her husband's taxi

loans.name: Bibi

texts.ru: Биби проживает в городе Куляб. Она замужем. Ей 50 лет. У нее пятеро детей. Ее дети находятся в России. Сама она занимается торговлей детской одежды. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 12 лет. Кредит берет для покупки костюмчиков и шапок.
texts.en: Bibi lives in the city of Kulob.  She is 50 years old, married and has five children.  Her children are in Russia.  Bibi is involved in selling children's clothing.  She has been in this business for 12 years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase suits and hats.

loans.use: to purchase suits and hats

loans.name: Brima

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 36-year-old Brima from Aberdeen western area in Freetown.  He is married with three children between the ages of three and ten years.  Two of his children attend school. 

Brima runs a carpentry and furniture store.  He sells wooden furniture like decorated beds, tables, chairs and dinner tables.  He has been running this business for eleven years.  He works at the business for eight hours per day and six days per week and has three employees working for him.  His other source of income comes from commercial taxis.  Brima says that the main challenge to his business is the difficulty in transporting material from the provinces to the city.

Brima has requested a loan in order to buy more timber and a plainer machine. The extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to export decorated beds. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more timber and a plainer machine.

loans.name: Fatou Seck

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou est une jeune dame de 36 ans, mariée qui exerce le commerce depuis  onze ans .Son activité consiste à vendre des vaisselles et divers  autres marchandises
Avec  ce prêt, elle va acheter de la vaisselle pour revendre  
Elle n’a pas de charges ce qui lui permettra de refinancer  son bénéfice dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Madame Fatou is 36 years old, married, and has been in business for 11 years.  She sells tableware and various other products. 
With this loan, she will purchase tableware to sell.  
She does not have anybody in her care, which will allow her to reinvest her earnings in her business.

loans.use: to buy tableware to sell.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is 27 years old and a farmer from the village of Chantliskure, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: his wife Irene and two little children. Omar earns a living through agriculture. He has a greenhouse, where cucumbers are grown during the whole year. Harvested cucumbers are sold at the local market. In addition, Omar has sheep. He sells lambs at the local market as well. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris.

Omar requested a loan to pay the rent for the land where his greenhouses are located. In addition, part of the loan will be used for purchasing polyethylene for covering the greenhouse, as the old cover is already torn and needs to be changed. Omar will get a better harvest as the new cover will keep the correct temperature in the greenhouse. He will sell the harvested cucumbers for a convenient price and get a good income. Omar will use part of the income for purchasing additional sheep and the biggest part of the income will be used for purchasing household goods to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay rent for land and purchase polyethylene cover for greenhouse

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 55-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only one child who is working and still studying at the same time. He has big responsibilities toward his family especially his child. He has been working as a supervisor in a local company since 2005. 

Today, he wants to borrow $2900 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his child’s university fees until graduation. He will be more than happy to see him achieving higher positions. In the future he plans to take out new Kiva loans to continue covering his child’s educational fees.

loans.use: to pay his child’s university fees until graduation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy water pipes, flex tubes, sockets and bottle taps.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 31 years old, married to George, and they have two children.

She has been operating a beauty shop selling hand and body lotions, hair treatment chemicals, and make-up for the last two years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 10,000. She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 15,000 to buy beauty products; lotions, hair treatment chemicals and make-up. With the anticipated profits she will save for future expansion. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

Her hopes and dreams are to open up a large beauty shop outlet and to employ people in her business.

loans.use: To buy hand and body lotions, hair chemicals, and make-up for resale.

loans.name: Demur

texts.en:
Demur lives in the village of Kvaliti, West Georgia with his family: his wife Ketevan, 40 years old, his son, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren (2, 3 and 5 years old). 

Demur works as a taxi driver in a nearby town. His son is leading the agricultural activities of the family. Ketevan and her daughter-in- law are housewives and care for the three children. 

The family has two milk cows. They produce and sell on average 30 kg of cheese at the local market. In addition, they have a pig, which gives to the family on average 10 piglets for sale per year. Along with the abovementioned, the family owns 1,500 wine trees. They produce wine and sell it locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 550 laris. 

Demur requested a loan for purchasing an additional milk cow. They will be able to produce more cheese, which will be sold at the local market. It will increase the income of the family by 16%. Demur will spend it for purchasing additional goods for the children, to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Santigie

texts.en:
Meet 50-year-old Santigie from Krootown, central area, in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is widower with four children between the ages of 8 years and 34 years. In 1974, Santigie established his tailoring and dress business. He began this business because he wanted to take care of his family. He works at the business from Monday until Sunday, 7 days per week, and 9:00 am- 8:00 pm. He also receives income from his children’s support. Even though his customer base has grown, his operating capital is not sufficient for maintaining inventory and receiving profits. For this reason, he is applying for a loan of Le 4,000,000.  

Santigie requires a loan in order to buy more lace, satin, sparkly, "Bamako" fabrics, and new machines. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to buy more machines so he can get more customers. In the future, Santigie plans to build a very big tailoring company. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more lace, satin, sparkly, and "Bamako" fabrics and new machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more materials to sew for her customers.

loans.name: Josef

texts.en:
Josef lives in the village of Boriti, West Georgia, with his family: his wife Maya, 26 years old, his son, and his 72-year- old mother. 

Josef works as a night-watchman and at the same time he runs a family agricultural business. He owns two milk cows and a pig. The family sells on average 30 kg of cheese per month and 10 piglets on the local market. Also, the family grows various vegetables on a family-owned 0.8 hectare plot of land. Total average income of the family is 900 Laris per month. 

Josef requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. The family will get more milk for cheese production. Sales of cheese will go up and the income of the family will increase by approximately 10%. It will allow the family to increase spending for satisfying their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 38 years old and is married to Mutheu.  They have three children.  He has been in the quarrying business for the last two years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000.

He is requesting his first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 20,000, with which he plans to purchase small equipment for quarrying i.e cold chisels, mattocks and hammers.  With the anticipated profits he will pay for his children's school fees.

His hopes are to establish a big mechanized quarry.

loans.use: to buy small quarrying equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoe soles and shoe leather.

loans.name: Arkadi

texts.en: Arkadi is a teacher at the local school who lives with his wife and two children. Unfortunately, his salary is too low to make ends meet, so he is also engaged in cattle breeding. Arkadi has applied for a loan to increase his herd and to purchase forage for the cattle. Development of the farm will allow him to increase his income, which will help him finish renovating his house and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and forage

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, age 59, is engaged in farming to earn a living. She has been farming for the last 13 years. She grows primarily tomatoes, green maize, and vegetables. For additional income, Susan also practices livestock farming. She and her husband have two children.
 
Susan hopes to grow her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings in order to buy insecticides and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara lives in the village of Lakhundara, West Georgia, with her husband Nugzar and 29-year-old son. Lamara runs a small grocery store in the village. Nugzar and his son work on the family's farm. They have four milk cows and eight pigs. The family members produce cheese and sell it on the local market, where they also sell piglets. Lamara purchases grocery products on the local market and sells them in her store. The family's total average monthly income is 550 GEL. 
Lamara has requested credit for purchasing a dairy cow. This will enable the family to produce more cheese and their income from cheese sales will increase. About 40 per cent of the total credit will be used to increase the stock in her store. For the New Year season more customers will go to the store, requesting various products, and Lamara wants to be ready to satisfy their requests. The sales and income of the store will increase. Lamara will use the increased income for improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and increase grocery store stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase large numbers of chicks and fodder.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Mwamko Ilela Group

texts.en:
Valentin is a 35-year-old father of five children, four of whom attend secondary education. He has grown maize, coffee, beans and cassava for over ten years. He works hard but earns a low income due to lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.
Valentin is looking for financial help to purchase fertilizers and insecticides. He also desires to expand the scale of his production from 5 to 14 acres in five years in the hope of earning more income for the family's clothes, food and medical expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina is 51 years old, married to Paul and blessed with two children. 

Salina owns a retail shop in Kapsabet town. She has been in the business for a period of three years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She is requesting a third loan from KADET Ltd. of KES 50,000. She plans to use the money to purchase more stock of wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil for her shop, with the anticipated profits to support her family.

Her dream is to own a wholesale shop and live a happy and successful life.

loans.use: To purchase stock of wheat and maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 27 years old, married and has two children.  He sells items such as cooking pans, plastic trays, basins, buckets, sandals and plates.  He also does farming in his rural home.  This has helped him to earn extra income for his family.  He works hard in his business to provide for his family including educating his two children. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to improve his business because he has been trained in business management skills. He needs a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane is a 45-year-old entrepreneur from Yerevan. She has been running a fruits and vegetables shop for more than 16 years. Gayane has applied for a loan to develop her business. Gayane plans to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. This loan will help Gayane to increase the sales and get more income. Additional income will allow her to insure a more stable and brighter future for her son.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 49 years old. She lives in the village of Ilemi, West Georgia. She has a family that includes her husband Murman and her 12-year-old daughter. 

Murman works as a cook in a village restaurant. Maya is leading the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of the income for them. In particular, the family owns two milk cows. Maya produces and sells on average 30 kg of cheese per month. Also, they have 50 hens and sell eggs and chickens. Along with the above-mentioned businesses, the family has a vineyard with 500 vine trees. Murman produces wine and sells it on local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 450 Laris. 

Maya requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. She will increase production and sales of cheese. It will increase the income of the family by 20%. Maya will use it for purchasing additional household goods in order to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 56 years old.  She has been operating a grocery business for 14 years.  She has retained her business because of her hard work and determination.  She has also been trained on business management skills.  This has helped her to improve her business.

Salome hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 28 years old and single. He is a businessman in Kapsabet town, owning a small phone accessories shop. He has been in operation selling mobile phone accessories such as chargers, batteries and keypads for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He is requesting his third loan of KES 60,000 from KADET Ltd. He plans to use this money to purchase more phone accessories; batteries chargers and key pads for his shop. The profits will be used to develop his new plot. 

His dreams are to prosper in business and live a happy life.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile accessories.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 33 years old and married to Amos. They have three children. She has been running a retail shop for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 6,000.

She is requesting her first loan with loan KADET Ltd. of KES 15,000 to buy stocks of maize and wheat flour, cereals, washing detergents, sugar and cooking oil. With the anticipated profits she will expand her business and educate her children.

Her dreams is to uplift the living standards of her family and own a wholesale store.

loans.use: to buy stock of wheat and maize flour, cereals, detergents, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is 40 years old, married and has two children.  To earn a living, she practices dairy farming.  She has been in the business for 13 years.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more financially stable. She has also been trained on business management skills. This has helped her to improve her business. She needs a loan of 35,000 Kenya shillings to buy animal feed.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena is 38 years old. She lives in Kitskhi village with her family: her husband, Mamushka, her 19-year-old son, 18-year-old daughter and her parents-in-law (retired). Shorena’s husband is a mini-bus driver. Shorena has a small grocery store. She purchases grocery products in a nearby town and sells them in her store. Also the family owns 2 milk cows and sells dairy products on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris, including the pensions of Shorena’s parents in law. 

Shorena has requested credit to increase the stock available in her store. For the New Year season more customers will go to the store, requesting various products and Shorena wants to be ready to satisfy their demands. The sales and income of the store will go up. Shorena will use the increased income to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to increase stock in her grocery store.

loans.name: Geghatsik

texts.en:
Geghetsik is 53 years old. She lives with her son, daughter-in-law and grandchild. Geghetsik works as a charwoman, and her son makes and sells boxes. 

Geghetsik is also engaged in agriculture. She has applied for a loan to develop her farm. With the requested loan, Geghetsik plans to purchase saplings and cattle. This loan will help Geghetsik to increase the income she gets from agriculture and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for saplings and cattle.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 46-year-old woman, married but with no children. She has been a travelling beauty expert for five years. On the request of her female customers, she goes to their houses to do their makeup or treat their hair and skin.  

Amal wants to purchase a new beauty kit to enhance her abilities at work. It would include hair oils and brushes, a hair dryer, skin creams, makeup colors...etc. In order to purchase the beauty kit, she needs to take a loan from FATEN of $2,000 to add to the sum she has already. 

This loan will enable Amal to enhance the quality of her work and increase her customers and income, allowing her to have better living conditions. The photo of Amal was taken in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase a beauty kit.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Tuimarike Ilela Group

texts.en:
Yansint is a 23-year-old married man with one child. He is good at farming activities. He has been producing maize, beans, coffee and cassava for over 15 years. He experiences agricultural problems including the lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Yansint is seeking working capital that can be used to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. Again, he has a future plan to expand his crop production from 6 to 15 acres in five years in expectation of earning more income for improving his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 27 years old and single.  He does mixed farming; he grows crops and also does dairy farming to earn a living.  He has been in the business for three years.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money.  His desire over the coming five years is to add cows to his farm.

Titus has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 31 years old and married. She is blessed with five children. She supports a family of nine.  

She owns a boutique in Kapngetuny trading center and has been in operation for a period of six years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She is requesting a third loan with KADET Ltd. of KES 60,000. She plans to use the funds to buy more stock of clothes for her business. She will save the anticipated profit to expand her business in the future and meet the basic needs of her family.

Her dream is to grow the business into a clothing distributor in her locality, and have a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothes.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 25-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and one working sibling. 

He works as a human resource manager in a local company and has reached an advanced level in his university but still needs to pay the rest of his study fees.  

For this reason, he’s requesting today to borrow $2,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his university fees in order to be able to pursue his master’s degree. 

In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans with the ambition to achieve higher educational levels.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Saeda

texts.en:
Saeda is a 27-year-old woman who is married and has three children. Her husband is a construction worker and his income barely covers his family’s basic needs.

So Saeda decided to help with the household expenses. After some thinking, she was able to buy prepaid credit for cellphones in wholesale and sell cellphone credit to her neighbors and friends. It is going well for her but she hasn't achieved the desired profit since she sells cheaply to be able to compete with large stores.

Therefore, Saeda would like to get a loan to be able to start her own small store to sell cellphone prepaid credit. She hopes to expand her project to include more cellphone accessories and be able to help her husband provide a better life for their family.

loans.use: to start her own small store to sell cellphone prepaid credit and possibly  more cellphone accessories.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 38 years old, married to Jennifer and they have three children. He has been in the business of water distribution using a hand cart for the last seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He is applying for his first loan with KADETL ltd. of KES 20,000 to buy  a donkey for pulling the  cart. He was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. He hopes to use the profits to complete building his house and to educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to own a water tanker to distribute water beyond his locality.

loans.use: To buy a donkey and a donkey cart for transporting water for sale.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 37 years old, married to Bonface and they have two children.  She has been operating a second hand clothes hawking business for the last nine years, earning a monthly income of KES 6,000.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 20,000 to buy stocks of second hand clothes to sell on.  With the anticipated profits she will expand her business and educate her children.

Her hope is to own and operate a clothing boutique in future.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell on.

loans.name: Ngumbi

texts.en:
Ngumbi is 74 years old. He is married and has five children, with just one of them under 15 years old. He lives in Mile 90 Nsongwa, a quarter in Bamenda in the North West Region of Cameroon.
Ngumbi joined Kiva partner GHAPE in 2005 and has successfully taken and repaid Empowerment Credit several times. He invested these loans in farming and used the profit to educate his children.
With this loan he will do some animal farming: poultry and pig rearing. He strongly believes this business will be a success because he has some experience in this line of business. The business will be of help to the community in that people in his neighbourhood will not have to go far in order to get pigs or birds for their consumption or for special occasions. The manure from his farm will also improve the yields of farmers in his locality.
With the proceeds from his loan, he will educate and provide medication for his family. He prefers a GHAPE loan because the interest rates are lower, repayment is in installments and repayment takes place in centres close to him, which means he avoids transportation expenses.

loans.use: to buy chicks, piglets and animal feed.

loans.name: Pardakhon

texts.ru: Пардахон жительница города Вахдат. Ей 59 лет. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. В ее семье только она работает. Она занимается торговлей. Пардахон арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает овощи и рис. Этим видом бизнеса она занимается три года. Кредит берет для покупки картошки, лука, моркови и разных сортов риса.
texts.en: Pardakhon is a resident of the city of Vahdat.  She is 59 years old, married and has six children.  She is the only one in her family working.  Pardakhon is involved in sales.  She leases a retail outlet at a market, where she sells vegetables and rice.  She has been in this business for three years.  Pardakhon is requesting this loan to purchase potatoes, onions, carrots and various types of rice.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, onions, carrots and various types of rice

loans.name: Rouweida

texts.en:
Rouweida is a 41-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and six children who are all attending school. Unlike other women in her place, Rouweida is working hard to help her husband and become both capable to satisfy their family needs and wants. She has owned a mini-market since 2007 in her town, and she feels happy with what she has attained so far. 

Today, she’s looking to borrow $2900 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy supplementary products such as groceries and provisions to be able to grow her business. In the future, she plans to open her own supermarket.

loans.use: to buy supplementary products such as groceries and provisions.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a single lady aged 27 years and has one child aged 5 years.  She owns a boutique in Kapsabet town. It has been in operation for a period of one year, earning a monthly income of Kes 8,000.

She is requesting her second loan of Kes 40,000 from KADET Ltd.  She intends to use the funds  to purchase more clothing for resale and the anticipated profit will be used to pay back the loan as well as provide for family upkeep.

She hopes to grow her business into a large-scale clothing store and live a successful life.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to stock her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 35 years old, married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She has run a food stall in Yei, South Sudan, for five years. Christine is requesting this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and onions for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and onions for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a printer, digital camera, and renovate the business premises.

loans.name: Luz Stella
