texts.es: La señora Luz Stella a sus 48 años se encuentra viuda y a su responsabilidad esta el sacar a su hijo adelante. Es por esto que desde hace mas de 20 años, se ha desempeñado como vendedora de mercancía, negocio que le ha permitido pagar los gastos de su hogar y brindarle las necesidades básicas a su hijo. Sus clientes son principalmente las personas de su sector, a quienes les ha ofrecido mercancía como productos para el hogar, ropa interior, prendas de vestir, entre otros. En busca de ofrecer en la temporada de fin de año prendas de vestir para sus clientes, requiere de la compra del surtido de mercancía para ofrecer gran variedad de sus productos y así garantizar buenos niveles de ventas. La señora Luz Stella sueña con que su negocio crezca, le pueda generar mayores ingresos y de esta forma poderle brindar todo lo que necesita su hijo, además quiere ahorrar para poderse comprar su propia casa y brindarle a su hijo una mayor estabilidad económica en su ausencia.
texts.en: Luz Stella is 48 years old. She is a widow and she is responsible for providing for her son. It is for this reason that she has been a retailer for more than 20 years, an activity she has engaged in to pay for her household expenses and to guarantee the basic necessities to her son. Her customers are mainly people form her own area, to whom she sells items such as home products, underwear and clothes, among others. Wanting to offer items of clothing to her customers during the year-end season, she needs to buy a stock of merchandise in order to offer a wider variety of products, thus granting herself a good selling rate. Luz Stella wishes for her activity to grow and to grant her a higher income, in order to allow her to give her son everything he needs. She also wants to save money to be able to buy a house of her own, in order to offer a better economic stability to her son in her absence.

loans.use: To buy items of clothing for the year-end season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To service her motorcycle.

loans.name: Papa Saliou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Papa Saliou âgé de 56 ans, est marié avec deux épouses .Il exerce le métier de menuisier ébéniste depuis  trente ans : il l’a démarré dès le bas âge.
Avec le crédit il  va acheter du bois et de la colle pour fabriquer des meubles. 
Avec  les bénéfices de son activité, il veut agrandir son atelier.
texts.en:
Mrs. Papa Saliou, age 56, is married to two women. He's been a cabinet and furniture maker for thirty years: he started very young.

With his loan, he will buy wood and glue to make furniture. With his profits, he wants to expand his workshop.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 22 years old and married to Mutisya, and they have two children. She has been running a quarrying business for the last two years earning a monthly income of Kes 2,000.

She is requesting for her first  loan with KADET ltd of Kes 20,000 to buy light quarrying equipment i.e cold chisels, mattocks, and hammers. With the anticipated profits, she will save to buy her own quarry.

Her hopes and dreams are to own her quarry and register a limited company to trade.

loans.use: to buy light quarrying tools.

loans.name: Falbe

texts.en:
Falbe is a 49-year-old married woman with six children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food in Yei, South Sudan, for six years.

Falbe is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 40 years old and a married woman with three children. All of them are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Susan is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of the children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret, a 43-year-old married mother of four, has owned  a green grocery store selling vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes for the past seven years, and has one employee. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Margaret has been able to educate her children, and she hopes to expand her business in the future. She is now requesting a loan for 50,000 KES to buy more vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Suh

texts.en:
Suh was born in 1942 and is married  to one wife. He has three children, none of which are under 15 years old. He lives in a six room house at mile 90 Nsongwa, situated in the Northwest Region of Cameroon. He has encounter so many problems in life like sickness, death of family members and theft. He hates to think about accidents, sickness, court cases, poor harvest and the death of his parents. Since he joined GHAPE in 2005, he has taken out and repaid five loans without any repayment difficulties and he hopes his business is going to be a success because more effort will be put in and most farmers will need to buy manure for farming since it will soon be farming season.

With the excess from the loan preparing to take, he will  improve on his farming system and will provide his family with some basic needs. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because it is a not-for-profit organization and they lend out money at a cheap interest rate, taking into consideration the poor and giving enough time for the loan to be paid back without collateral.

loans.use: To buy oil, food items, to farm and rear pigs.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda   is a 27-year-old business lady who owns a grocery store in Mshomoroni Mombasa. She is married. She has been doing this business for the last eight years and she is doing great. She was recently introduced to KADET and this marks her first loan. She plans to use the loan to purchase more potatoes, cabbages and tomatoes for sale. She will use the proceeds from the business to repay her loan and expand her business even further. 
She hopes to realize more profits as a result of  the business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase more potatoes, cabbages and tomatoes.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is 33 years old and does construction to earn a living. He has been in the business for 4 years. He describes his business as good and favorable due to the high number of clients who require his services. He also runs a barber shop. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has  become stable financially. He hopes to expand his business to a big construction firm in the future. He has applied for KES 100,000 to buy a mixer.

loans.use: To buy a mixer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Makau

texts.en: Makau is 39 years old and married with three children aged 9,13 and 16. She owns a grocery shop and has been in the business for six years. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to manage her finances. She wants to open a shop and also be the main distributor of vegetables in the future. She has applied for KES 50,000 to buy tomatoes, potatoes, onions and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes, onions and vegetables.

loans.name: Shamsiddin

texts.ru: Шамсиддин житель района Дангара. Возраст, 61 год. Женат. Имеет пятерых детей. Его дети работаю и живут отдельно. Сам он имеет среднее образование. Он более 12 лет занимается изготовлением сундуков. Кредит берет для закупа досок.
texts.en: Shamsiddin is a resident of the Dangara district.  He is 61 years old, married and has five children.  His children work and live separately.  Shamsiddin has a secondary education.  He has been involved in making chests for over 12 years.  Shamsiddin is requesting this loan to purchase wood planks.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en:
Evelyne, age 30 and married, owns a beauty salon. She has been in this business for four years and has employed two people. She describes her business environment as competitive due to the existence of many people offering the same kinds of services.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to set aside a portion of her income into savings. She hopes to open another salon in the future.

She has applied for 40,000 to buy cosmetics to use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to use in her salon

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia, who is a 41-year-old woman, is a mother of two sons. Her husband has had an internet cafe for four years with low income, so he decided to expand his cafe by purchasing more computers to be used by his customers. This way, he will increase the number of customers and so increase his income. However, the amount of money he has isn't enough to buy the computers, so his wife Alia decided to help and get a loan from FATEN for $1,500. When Alia gets the loan, she will enable her husband to expand the internet cafe which is the only source of income for the family to purchase additional computers. This will increase the number of customers who will come and use these computers and so his income will increase positively to provide better living conditions for his family. Alia is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed in the internet cafe.

loans.use: To purchase a number of computers for her husband's internet cafe.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is 25 years old, married to Charles, and they have one child. She has been in the business of rearing cattle and piglets for the last two years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 6,000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes. 10,000. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer. She plans to use the loan to buy another dairy cow and piglets.

Her dreams are to expand her business into large-scale dairy farming and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more dairy  cattle and piglets for rearing.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is a 30 year-old married woman with five children; all of them are in school. She has been in the business of selling charcoal in yei south Sudan for three years.

Celina is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is 35 years old. She owns a beauty shop, a business she has done for 5 years, and has employed two people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income. She hopes to increase the size of her salon in future. She has applied for KES 100,000 to buy beauty products.

loans.use: To  buy beauty products.

loans.name: Arpine

texts.en: Arpine is a 34-year-old entrepreneur from Yerevan. She has been running a kindergarten for four years. Arpine has applied for a loan to improve conditions in the kindergarten. She plans to pay for renovating the heating system. This will help Arpine to attract new clients and expand the kindergarten in the future.

loans.use: to pay for heating system renovation

loans.name: Maria Berenice

texts.es: La señora Maria Berenice se dedica desde hace 6 años a la fabricación de artículos de cuero, actividad con la cual genera ingresos para su hogar donde convive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. La señora Maria Berenice con sus 48 años, requiere de la compra de una máquina guarnecedora la cual le permita ser mas eficiente en su trabajo y así poder aumentar sus ingresos para mejorarles la calidad de vida a sus hijos, además de tener mas tiempo disponible para ellos. Maria Berenice sueña en un futuro con tener un local en la zona comercial de su municipio Sonson, ubicado al oriente de Antioquia, y poder así brindarle una estabilidad económica a su hogar.
texts.en: Maria Berenice has been engaging in creating leather items for 6 years, an activity thanks to which she earns money for her family, composed of her husband and their three children. Maria Bernenice is 48 years old. She needs to buy an industrial sewing machine that will help her being more efficient in her work, thus enabling her to increase her income and consequently improving the standard of living of her children, on top of gaining more free time to spend with them. In the future, Maria Berenice hopes to own a shop in the commercial area of Sonson, the town where she lives, located east of Antioquia, in order to give economic stability to her family.

loans.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en: Wycliffe is 34 years old and single. His business is repairing worn out shoes. He has been in the business for 4 years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to expand his business. He hopes to have a good life and be financially stable in the future. He has applied for KES 25,000 to buy leather, soles and glue.

loans.use: To buy leather, soles and glue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food to stock for her cafe.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 25-year-old married woman with no children. She has had a business selling tea in Yei, South Sudan for two years. Charity is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is 31 years old and married with two children who are three and nine years old. He owns a butchery. He has been in the business for 10 years and has employed four people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to buy his own cows. He hopes to buy a plot and expand his butchery shop in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy cows.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Anne Irene

texts.en: Irene, 42 years old, is married and has two children, aged 20 and 23. She has been selling used shoes to earn a living for 12 years. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, her business has grown. Irene hopes to have a stable business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy more shoes.

loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: La señora Esther  cuenta con domicilio propio, se dedica al tejido de chambras (chompas de bebe) a mano, vive con su esposo, este mismo esta tramitando su jubilación, viven solos los dos en su casa, mientras tramita se jubilación el esposo de la señora Esther es ella quien esta manteniendo su hogar ya que corre con todos los gastos incluso con los gastos de la tramites, el crédito lo necesita para comprar variedad de lanas y así  tejer otro tipo de ropa de bebe para poder diversificar su oferta de prendas, estas mismas las vende en los distintos mercados de la ciudad d Cochabamba, también entrega según pedidos ya que  deja a clientes ya asiduos de la señora, la Sra. es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Esther owns her house and works knitting “chambras” (baby sweaters) by hand.  She lives with her husband who is processing his retirement.  The two of them live alone in their house.  While her husband is processing his retirement, Esther is the household’s sole source of support since all the expenses, including the retirement paperwork, is her responsibility.

She needs the loan to buy a variety of yarn so that she can knit another type of baby clothes so that she can diversify her offerings which she sells in various markets in the city of Cochabamba; she also sells based on prior orders from her regular customers.  She is a very hardworking woman who feels happy about the opportunity she’s being offered since this is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael, 34 years old, is married and has one child, aged 4.  Raphael has been doing dairy and crop farming for 8 years and employs one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to increase his  farm production. He hopes to grow his dairy business in the future. Raphael has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to add to his savings to buy a cow.

loans.use: To add to his savings to buy a cow

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 36 years old, married to Bernard, and they have three children. She has been in the business of rearing goats for sale for the last four years. She earns a monthly income of Kes 10,000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 10,000. She plans to use the funds to purchase more goats for rearing and resale.

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business into a large-scale goat rearing farm and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy many goats for rearing.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is a 27-year-old, married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. Amira has had a food stall business in Yei, South Sudan for 2 years.

Amira is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a 50-year-old single woman with one child. She sells used clothes to earn a living and has been in this business for four years. Since Mildred joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya her business has grown. She hopes to have a stable business in the future. 
Mildred has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Antokia Group

texts.en:
Kenedy, who is in his late forties, is married and has four children. He  has been running a hardware shop for six years. He works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Kenedy’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase the stock of the missing items. He has repaid all of his loans successfully. He wants a loan to  increase stock on his hardware shop.  His dream is to one day be able to open another shop in a different area.

Kenedy will share this loan with his group, "Antokia" which consists of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase stock on his hardware shop.

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es: A sus 32 años, Maria Elvira es una madre cabeza de familia donde tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Debido a la separación con su esposo, Maria Elvira se vio en la necesidad de recurrir al trabajo para poder cargar con los gastos del hogar. Inició en un puesto de legumbrería donde con su trabajo logró aprender lo necesario y luego con sus ahorros montó su propio puesto de legumbres en el parque principal de Támesis, al Suroeste de Antioquia. Desde entonces ha venido trabajando fuertemente con el ánimo de sacar sus hijos adelante y poderles brindar la educación que requieren. Sueña con poder incrementar sus ventas, que su negocio crezca y dejarles un legado a sus hijos donde puedan trabajar y donde puedan encontrar una estabilidad económica. Quiere que en un futuro sus hijos puedan comprar sus propias casas con su trabajo y para eso mantiene la búsqueda inalcanzable del crecimiento de su negocio; es por esto que requiere de la compra de legumbres para incrementar el surtido de su legumbrería y hacerla más atractiva para sus clientes, de modo que incremente sus ventas y pueda lograr mejorarle la calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Maria Elvira, 32, is a mother and head of household with 2 children in her care.  Because she separated from her husband, Maria Elvira saw the need to return to work so that she could take on the burden of the household expenses.  She started out working in a sales post selling vegetables where she managed to learn what she needed about this type of work, and later with her savings she established her own post selling vegetables in the main park of  Támesis, to the southeast of Antioquia.  Since then, she has been working hard with the aim of providing for her children, and providing them with the education that they need.  She dreams of being able to increase her sales, of growing her business so that she can leave a legacy to her children where they can work and have economic stability.  In the future she wants her children to be able to buy their own homes with their work, and so for this reason she sustains a relentless pursuit of business growth.  To do this, she needs to buy vegetables to increase the inventory of her sales post and make it more attractive to customers, so that she can increase her sales and achieve a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to increase the inventory of her business

loans.name: Elida Del Socorro

texts.es: Elida del Socorro tiene 54 años de edad, su actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería  está ubicada en su casa de habitación, sus mayores clientes son sus vecinos y los clientes eventuales de la localidad donde está ubicada, este negocio lo emprende Elida por la necesidad de generar ingresos a la familia. Elida tiene 2 hijos mayores en cual la apoyan económicamente. Elida del socorro está solicitando crédito a Fundación León 2000, para invertir en el negocio lo cual con el crédito comprara granos básicos, jabón, aceite, golosinas entre otros productos del hogar que son buscados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elida del Socorro, 54, has a grocery store located at home.  Most of her customers are her neighbors and walk-in customers from the surrounding area.  Elida is in this business because she needs to generate family income.

Elida has two adult children that help her out economically.  Elida del Socorro is asking Fundación León 2000 for a loan to invest in her store buying basic grains, soap, oil and snacks, among other household products that are sought after by her customers.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es: A sus 42 años, el señor Carlos Mario cuenta con un coche dirigido por un caballo en el cual vende legumbres a los habitantes del municipio de Rionegro, al oriente de Antioquia. Cuenta con 4 hijos por los cuales trabaja diariamente con mucho esfuerzo y a los que les quiere brindar la mejor educación y la mejor calidad de vida. Desde hace 15 años, Carlos Mario conoce la actividad de vender legumbres y quiere que su negocio crezca y se consolide como un referente en su municipio. Para poder seguir creciendo, Carlos Mario requiere de la compra de más legumbres para surtir su negocio, y poder así ofrecerles más variedad a sus clientes. Sueña con brindar a sus hijos un hogar estable económicamente donde puedan crecer con todas las necesidades cubiertas y donde puedan acceder a la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
At the age of 42, Carlos Mario has a horse-drawn cart that he uses to sell vegetables to residents of Rionegro in east Antioquia.  He has four children that he works hard daily for with much effort because he wants to give them a better education and quality of life.

For fifteen years, Carlos Mario has been in the vegetable sales business and he wants his business to grow and become a standout in his town.  To continue growing, Carlos Mario needs to buy more vegetables to stock his business and offer more variety to his customers.

He dreams with providing a home for his children that has economic stability where they can grow up with all their basic needs met and where they can have access to the best possible education.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Alba Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Alba del Socorro a sus 58 años de edad se dedica a la venta de productos de papelería en un lugar adecuado en la sala de su casa, luego de quedar viuda hace algunos años, le tocó sacar sola a sus hijos adelante y con la ayuda de la papelería ha logrado sostenerse económicamente y afectivamente. Con el ánimo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos, la señora Alba del Socorro necesita de la compra de surtido que le permita mejorar sus ventas y a largo plazo cumplir su sueño de tener su propio almacén y ver como profesionales a sus dos hijos de 18 y 16 años de edad.
texts.en: Alba del Socorro is 58 years old and runs a small office supply store from her house.  After her husband died several years ago, Alba needed to support her children on her own and the income from this business helped support the family.   Motivated to improve the quality of life for herself and her children, Alba wants to invest in her business and this loan will enable her to increase her sales.   Longer term, her dream is to have her own paper store and to see her children, now 18 and 16, with good jobs as well.

loans.use: to stock her store with notepads, books and pens.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es: Fanny(en viaje de negocios) es la madre de Lenis quien aparece en la fotografía y describe la historia del negocio de su madre desde que iniciaron la fabricación y comercializcion de bolsos de cuero y de calzado.  “ El  negocio comienza hace 10 años, cuando comenzamos a venderle productos como calzado y sandalias a compañeras de estudios en el bachillerato, cuando estudiaba   en el barrio arroz Barato de la ciudad de Cartagena, luego con el conocimiento de los productos , las ventas fueron creciendo y las mujeres día a día se inquietaban por conocer nuevos productos, así fue como  incluimos   la línea de bolsos además de la línea de calzado y accesorios, esta vez para damas y caballeros; en la medida en que yo iba estudiando en el Sena, escuela técnica apoyada por el estado ,  las personas cada vez se enamoraban de los productos hasta que empecé a trabajar en el área de finanzas en diferentes empresas  y la lista de clientes se incrementaba cada día, fue entonces cuando el negocio tomó  fuerzas  y además de vender artesanías de nuestra tierra natal que es Momil, en el departamento de Córdoba, con los materiales de caña flecha y otros como el cuero, también iniciamos negocios con mujeres tejedoras de san Jacinto Bolívar. Después de todos estos años con un negocio informal,  es en el 2009 que con la participación en un concurso de planes de negocios de varias organizaciones,  nos ganamos un capital semilla para comprar nuestra propia maquinaria, fue gracias a la viabilidad del proyecto y por todas las características de rentabilidad y participación en el desarrollo social de familias artesanas,  lo que nos hizo  merecedores del tercer lugar con $4.000.000 COP,  para iniciar el negocio,  el cual arrojó  como resultado la preferencia que los clientes tienen hacia los productos fusionados con cuero y caña flecha Así fue que decidimos formalizarnos ante Cámara de Comercio, la cual nos ha venido apoyando con programas de emprendimiento y empresario, en su programa de  jóvenes empresarios, mujeres,  ecco ferias a nivel local y regional, foros, y ruedas de negocios, estamos muy agradecidas con esta entidad por el apoyo en las asesorías financieras, de mercadeo y de estrategias que nos han brindado;  hace poco recibimos un microcrédito de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y también le estamos agradecidas debido a que el factor monetario a sido un verdadero reto de afrontar ,  ya que los recursos son pocos pero a pesar de todo hemos salido a delante y este año 2011 ha sido más que todo de arranque ya que para el 2012 nos vemos con el favor de Dios con metas por luchar y cumplir. Siempre hemos trabajado en equipo,  mi mamá   en el área más que todo de producción, publicidad  y ventas y  yo, además de apoyar los procesos productivos y de comercialización,   hago toda la gestión en grandes eventos feriales, locales, nacionales  empresariales, pues   por  haber  calificado como profesional de una institución educativa tecnológica,  tengo la oportunidad de acceder en todos estos programas de las organizaciones que apoya el estado nacional para generar potenciales empleos en Colombia.  Es para nosotras muy grato poder compartirles nuestra pequeña experiencia y sobre todo manifestarles lo mucho que amamos nuestro negocio y el gran compromiso y responsabilidad que tenemos para sacarlo cada vez mas adelante, especialmente apoyadas por los  credikiva, el cual aplicaremos a la compra de cuero en gran volumen, para elaborar bolsos y calzados de buena calidad y exhibirlos en la época mas comercial del año Navidad y año nuevo.”
texts.en:
Fanny (away on a business trip) is the mother of Lenis, who appears in the photograph and describes her mother’s business that they started which is the making and selling of leather purses and shoes.  

“The business started ten years ago when we started selling items like shoes and sandals to fellow high-school students when I was attending school in Cartagena’s Arroz Barato neighborhood.  As we got to know the products better, sales improved and women were excited to see the new products daily.  This is how we included a line of purses to the line of footwear and accessories this time for women and men.  As I continued attending classes at SENA, a government-supported technical school, people became more and more enamored with the products until I started working in the financial area in various firms and our customer roster grew daily.  That was when the business really took off and besides selling crafts from our native land which is Momil in Córdoba Department which are made from “caña flecha” [a tall, tropical grass] and leather, we also started businesses with weavers in San Jacinto, Bolívar.

After all these years in an informal business, in 2009 we participated in a business plan contest from various organizations and won seed capital to buy our own machinery.  Thanks to the viability of the project and because of its profitability characteristic s and the participation of artisanal families in social development, we won third prize: $4.000.000 COP to start the business which took off due to customer preference for items that combine caña flecha and leather.  

We then decided to formalize ourselves with the Chamber of Commerce which has been supporting us with business and entrepreneurial programs as part of their programs for young business people, women, local and regional eco fairs, forums and business roundtables.  We are very grateful to this entity for the support in financial, marketing and strategy assessments it’s afforded us.  

A short while ago we received a micro loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and we are also grateful to it because the monetary factor has been a real challenge to face since resources are few.  Despite it all, we have gotten ahead and 2011 has been for the most part a launching pad for 2012 when we have goals to strive toward and with God’s favor to meet.

We’ve always worked as a team.  My mother in the production, publicity and sales areas and myself, in addition to supporting productive and commercialization efforts, I take care of everything related to the sales expos both locally and nationally because having qualified as a professional from a technological educational institution, I have the opportunity to access all Colombian potential jobs.

For us, it’s very gratifying to share our small experience and especially to show you how much we love our business and the great commitment and responsibility we have to see it succeed more every day especially with support from Kiva loans which we will use to buy leather in large amounts to manufacture good quality purses and footwear to exhibit during the most commercial season which is Christmas and New Year.”

loans.use: to buy leather in large amounts.

loans.name: Duval Enrique

texts.es: Duval Enrique es un emprendedor que se le ha brindado apoyo con el financiamiento para invertir en sus negocio en cual el nos expresa que aumentado su producción con los cerdos que compro y esto le ha permitido ir creciendo en el negocio y en lo personal por que cada día tiene un cliente mas a que atender. Actualmente Duval está solicitando crédito para comprar más cerdos para destazar y su alimentación de los animales y así poder cubrir a todos los pedidos que tiene que entregar.
texts.en: Duval Enrique is an entrepreneur who has been given support with financing for his business. He tells us he has increased his production with the pigs that he bought. This has allowed him to continue growing, in the business and personally, because every day he has another client to serve. Currently Duval is asking for a loan to buy more pigs for slaughter, as well as animal feed, in order to be able to cover all the orders he has to deliver.

loans.use: to buy pigs for slaughter and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Maria Leucadia

texts.es: Leucadia tiene 52 años de edad esta casada con el señor Aristeo y tienen 7 hijos pero nada mas 5 viven con ellos los cuales estudian la primaria y la secundaria. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora con ganas de salir adelante, ella desde hace mas de 12 años se dedica al cultivo de aguacate ya que su región es prolifera para que se de un buen aguacate, platica que en el año hay dos temporadas fuertes para su cosecha aguacate la cual obtiene buenas ganancias en esta temporada, dice que sus hijos le ayudan a la corta el fruto y lo sacan a vender por cubetas en la central de abastos de una población cercana a su localidad y dice que cuando no es temporada de aguacate se dedica a vender artesanía de Ocoshal en la capital del país. Doña Leucadia esta pidiendo un crédito para comprar insumos para el cultivo y el  buen estado de sus arboles como insecticidas, abonos orgánicos, fertilizantes, calidra y cajas para empacar el aguacate. La meta que tiene la señora es seguir progresando con su negocio y seguir abriéndose mercado en diferentes poblaciones de su estado para vender más rápido el fruto que cultiva. Dice que esta muy agradecida con la empresa por que gracias a esta ella puede comprar lo necesario para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Leucadia, 52, is married to Aristeo and has 7 children.  The five who live with them are in primary and secondary school.  She is a hardworking woman who wants to get ahead.  For more than 12 years, she has grown avocados, since her region has the right conditions for good avocados and has two strong seasons for harvesting them.  She makes good money out of the current season.  Her children help her to cut the fruit and take them to sell them by the tray in the wholesale market of a nearby town.  She says that when it is not the avocado season, she sells handicrafts from Ocoshal in the country's capital.  

Doña Leucadia is seeking a loan to buy material for her crops and to keep her trees in good shape, such as insecticide, compost,  fertilizers, lime and boxes in which to pack the avocados.  Her goal is to keep up her business and to open up a market in different towns in her state so as to sell the fruit she grows more quickly.  She thanks Kiva's Field Partner for helping her to buy what she needs to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, compost, fertilizer, lime and boxes in which to pack avocados.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: La señora Felipa es una persona trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora a pesar de su edad , se dedica a la venta de comida la atención es por las mañanas donde ofrece caldos y sopas  a medio día prepara  almuerzos completos entre otros ; su pensión esta ubicada en su mismo domicilio son  7 años que se dedica a esta actividad, , actual mente se encuentra viviendo en casa familiar en  una zona periurbana de la ciudad de Cochabamba ubicada al sud,  el destino del crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos como arroz, papa , carne , aceite, para la elaboración de sus riquísimos platillos,  la señora indica que el crédito otorgado  le ayudara a seguir desarrollando su actividad económica.
texts.en:
In spite of her age, Felipa is a hard-working, responsible, and enterprising woman.  She works selling food.  In the mornings, she offers soup and broth, and at mid-day she prepares full lunches and other items.  Her restaurant is located in her home.  She has done this work for seven years.  She currently lives in her family home in the peri-urban area to the south of the city of Cochabamba.  

She will invest the loan in the purchase of ingredients such as rice, potato, meat, and oil to make her rich dishes.  Felipa says that the loan provided will help her continue developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, potato, meat, and oil to make her rich dishes.

loans.name: Monica Deicy

texts.es: Mónica es una joven de 20 años emprendedora del municipio de San Carlos al oriente de Antioquia, donde vende mercancía como joyas, accesorios, relojes y demás. La actividad la aprendió trabajando en almacenes, donde además conoció los proveedores y los clientes. Ahora Mónica se ha independizado con el fin de lograr mejores ingresos, con los cuales busca cubrir sus gastos personales y poder pagar su educación. Con el objetivo de aprovechar la temporada de fin de año, Mónica requiere de la compra de mercancía para ampliar los productos que ofrece a sus clientes y también invertir en un exhibidor que logre mejorar la imagen de la venta de sus productos. Sueña con que su negocio crezca, poder montar un almacén que la gente pueda visitar y la tenga como una referente para las compras de sus accesorios.
texts.en: Monica is a 20 year old, enterprising young woman from the municipality of San Carlos near Antioquia.  She sells jewelry, accessories, watches and other items.  She learned this business working in various shops, where she also got to know the clients and the manufacturers.  Now Monica has started working on her own with the goal of increasing her income, which she needs to cover her expenses and pay for her education.  She'd like to take advantage of the end of year holiday season and expand the merchandise she can offer to her customers.   She'd also like to invest in a display case to present a better image of her jewelry and accessories.  Her dream is that her business will grow, and she will be able to open a shop that people can come to visit.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and a jewelry display case for her business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia tiene 58 años de edad es viuda y tubo 5 hijos pero ella vive sola ya que ellos están casados. Platica que es originaria de una localidad muy rica en naturaleza ya  que las personas de su localidad resguardan los bosques debido a que hay talamontes que cortan los arboles sin permiso. Dice que en su comunidad la gente preserva sus raíces ya que hablan y visten el mazahua lo cual es un orgullo para ella. Doña Amelia dice que desde hace mas de 2 años empezó a cultivar  aguacate ella comenta “aunque es un negocio a largo plazo me agrada cultivar este fruto por que se presta a las condiciones del clima de mi localidad y no es muy difícil de cuidar ya falta poco para que se den los frutos en el mes de mayo si Dios quiere voy a tener mi primera cosecha aunque ya varios de los arbolitos empezaron a dar fruto”. Dice que  ahorita como no tiene ganancias de los aguacates se dedica hacer artesanía de ocoshal como son servilleteros, paneras, tortilleros, alhajeros, fruteros, jarrones para decoración y los saca a vender al santuario de la mariposa monarca ya  que muy cerca de su localidad se encuentra. Amelia esta pidiendo un crédito para comprar insecticidas, abono orgánico, fertilizantes, calidra y arboles de aguacate. La meta de doña Amelia es seguir haciendo crecer su huerto y cuando empiece a tener ganancias quiere poner la cerca nueva para que los animales no se le metan a comer sus arboles. Dice que ella esta muy contenta con trabajar con la financiera por que gracias a esta su negocio si esta funcionando y espera nunca defraudarla ya que le tendieron la mano cuando mas lo necesitaba.
texts.en:
Amelia is a 58 year old widow.  She had five children, but she lives alone because her children are married.

She says that she is from a place that is rich in nature.  The inhabitants safeguard the forests because the loggers cut the trees without permission.  She says that in her community the people preserve their roots.  They speak and dress “mazahua” (an indigenous people of Mexico), which they are proud of.

Amelia says she started to grow avocadoes over two years ago.  She says that, “even though it is a business in the long term, it pleases me to grow this fruit because it is well suited to the climate.  The crop is not difficult to take care of, and shortly they will bear fruit in May.  God willing, I will have my first harvest even though various little trees started to bear fruit.”  

She says that now, as she does not have any income from the avocados, she makes crafts from “ocoshal” (dry leaves that come from a pine tree).  She makes things like napkin rings, bread baskets, jewelry cases, fruit dishes, and decorative vases.  She takes them to sell at the Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary because it is very close to her area.  

Amelia is asking for a loan to buy insecticides, organic fertilizer, fertilizers, Calidra (brand of hydrated lime powder), and avocado trees.   Amelia’s goal is to continue making her orchard grow.  When she starts to have income she wants to put up a new fence so that the animals do not get in and eat her trees.  

She says that she is very happy to work with the loan because, thanks to the loan, her business is functioning.  She hopes to never let the lenders down because they lent a hand when she needed it most.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, organic fertilizer, fertilizers, Calidra (brand of hydrated lime powder), and avocado trees.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 31 años de edad esta casada con el señor Ezequiel y tiene 3 hijos pequeños, desde hace un poco mas de 3 años se dedica a  cultivar aguacate en su comunidad ya que su papa le heredo un terreno amplio y ella decidió ponerse a trabajar para sacar ganancias para el futuro de sus hijos, ella dice “en esta época para vivir mas o menos las parejas tenemos que trabajar para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a nuestros hijos ya que no alcanza si nada mas trabaja el esposo, es por eso que quiero salir adelante con mi familia para vivir mejor”. Irma  esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de árboles de aguacate,  abonos orgánicos, calidra para que no le caiga plagas a los arboles y fertilizantes orgánicos para no dañar la tierra. Dice que cuando no es temporada de cosecha se pone hacer artesanía de Ocoshal y la saca a vender a centros turísticos de su estado. La meta que tiene Irma es seguir invirtiéndole en el negocio del aguacate ya que si deja un poco mas de ganancias que la venta de la artesanía.
texts.en:
Irma is 31 years old, married to Ezequiel, and has three small children. She was worked farming avocados for a little more than three years on a big plot of land she inherited from her father. She decided to begin working to earn money for her children's future. She says "at this time, in order to live, both spouses have to work in order to give a better quality of life to our children. It's not enough if just the husband works, and I want to help my family get ahead and live better."

Irma is asking for a loan to buy avocado trees, Calidra, to protect the trees from plagues, and organic fertilizers that will not harm the land. She says when it is not harvest season she works making Ocoshal handicrafts to sell at tourist shops in her state. Irma's goal is to keep investing in her avocado business since it provides a little more profit than selling handicrafts.

loans.use: buy avocado trees, Calidra (to prevent plagues), and organic fertilizer so as not to harm the land

loans.name: Maria Crisanta

texts.es: Crisanta tiene 28 años de edad esta casada con el señor Benito el cual es albañil y tienen 3 niños los cuales dos estudian, dice que  en su localidad la mayoría de las personas se dedican a hacer la artesanía de ocoshal y que es algo característico de su localidad y que todavía preservan sus raíces ya que la mayoría de la personas hablan el dialecto mazahua y visten con faldones de la cultura mazahua. Ella desde hace mas de 8 años se dedica a cultivar aguacate dice que su esposo fue el que emprendió el negocio para tener un poco mas de ganancias ya que con lo que ganad de albañil no le alcanzaba para mantener a su familia y por eso empezó hacer el huerto de aguacates. Platica Cris como de cariño le dicen en su casa en cuando no hay fruto hace artesanía de Ocoshal ya que la materia prima la sacan de las palmitas secas del encino. Ella quiere un préstamo para el mantenimiento de su huerto ya que comprara insumos como abonos orgánicos, calidra  para eliminar las plagas y ella quisiera comprar una bomba de agua para trasladar el agua hasta el huerto ya que tienen que contratar animales para que le suban el agua al cerro para regar los arboles. Esta muy contenta por que gracias a los créditos que  ha obtenido atravez de la financiera le han servido porque ha comprado insumos de mejor calidad y así puede ofrecerle a sus clientes un fruto de mejor calidad y dice que así poco a poco se ha abierto mercado en diferentes municipios de su estado y eso la tiene muy contenta por que quiere decir que los créditos le sirven de mucho. La meta que tiene doña Crisanta es seguir haciendo crecer el negocio y comprar una camioneta de uso para facilitar el transporte del aguacate ya que cuando van a venderlo tienen que agar flete.
texts.en:
Crisanta, 28, is married to Benito who is a bricklayer and they have three children two of which attend school.  She says that in her community most residents make ocoshal crafts  which are characteristic of her location and which still maintain their roots since most people speak the Mazahua dialect and wear traditional Mazahua skirts.

She says that she’s been an avocado farmer for more than 8 years.  She says that it was her husband who started the business to earn a bit more profits since what he earned as a bricklayer did not suffice to support the family so he started to make an avocado orchard.

Cris, which is what she’s affectionately called at home, relates that when there is no fruit she makes Ocoshal crafts since the raw materials for it are extracted from dry oak palm fronds.  She wants a loan for crop maintenance since she will buy farm supplies like organic manure, Calidra [brand of hydrated lime powder] to eradicate infestations; she’d also like to buy a water pump to pump water to the orchard since she now has to rely on animals to carry water up the hill to water the trees.

She is very happy because thanks to the loans she’s gotten from the lending organization she’s been able to buy better quality supplies so that she can offer her customers better quality fruit in the future.  She says that little by little this way she’s been opening up markets for herself in various municipalities in her state and this makes her very happy because she wants to say that the loans are very useful for her.  Crisanta’s goal is to continue to make her business grow and to buy a pick-up truck to facilitate transport of the avocadoes since they currently have to pay transportation costs when they want to go sell them.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and a water pump.

loans.name: Sorry For Me Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Sorry For Me” group from Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone where Shine on Sierra Leone has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 2,700,000 SLL for the entire group. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Sento is the leader of this group. The 25 year old is married to a businessman and together they have four children, two of whom are attending primary schools. 

Sento has been a businesswoman for thirteen years now. She sells market food such as rice, palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), peppers, gari (food made out of cassava roots), etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock. 

(Also included in the left of the photo is loan officer Kadiatu Bah, handing over the loan to the borrowers)

loans.use: to buy rice, palm-oil, peppers, gari, etc., at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar es una persona muy emprendedora, él vive en Camaná, Perú, un oasis en el otro modo de largo y seco desierto de Sechura que domina la costa en la parte sudoeste del país. Camaná ha sido históricamente un importante destino turístico en el Perú, sin embargo, los frecuentes y fuertes terremotos y tsunamis en la última década (un 8,4 en 2001 y 8,0 en 2007) diezmó la ciudad. Gracias a la naturaleza y el ambiente en donde el vive puede dedicarse en sus tiempos libres a la actividad que más le agrada "Pescar"; como se sabe nuestro Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Edgar  le agrada mucho es el “chupe de Camarones”, es un platillo que consta de una sopa hecha a base de camarones, en la cual se añade pallares verdes, queso y leche. 

A Edgar le hubiese gustado poder estudiar Mecánica Automotriz, pero debido a diversos factores, no pudo llegar a estudiar lo que deseaba. Él se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público en la ciudad de Camaná, y siempre en las calles del barrio en donde vive. Con esfuerzo y dedicación diaria, él puede ganar hasta S/.50 en un día, lo que le permite cubrir sus gastos personales y laborales.

Gracias a los prestatarios Kiva el podrá darle manteniento a su Moto Taxi y así poder brindar un mejor servicio, esto también le brindará confianza cuando este laborando, debido a que tendrá la certeza de que el vehículo no se averiará rapidamente. Edgar sueña con poder compra un terreno para poder empezar a constuir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Edgar is a very enterprising person.  He lives in Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long and dry desert of Sechura that dominates the coast in the southeast part of the country.  Camaná has historically been an important tourism destination in Perú.  However, the frequent, strong earthquakes and tsunamis in the past decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and an 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city.  Thanks to the nature and the environment where he lives, he’s able to spend his free time in the activity which he most enjoys: Fishing.  As he is well aware, our Perú is noted for having the most delicious food in the world and one of Edgar’s favorite is “Chupe de Camarones,” a dish consisting of a soup made from a shrimp base to which are added green beans, cheese and milk.

Edgar would have liked to study Auto Mechanics but due to various factors he was unable to pursue the studies he desired.  He works providing public transportation services in the city of Camaná always along the streets in his neighborhood.  With effort and daily dedication he can manage to earn up to 50 soles daily which allows him to cover his personal and work expenses.

Thanks to Kiva lenders he will be able to service his mototaxi to provide better service.  This will also make him feel more at ease while working because he’ll have the certainty that his vehicle will not quickly suffer any malfunctions.  Edgar dreams with being able to buy a piece of land to start building his own house.

loans.use: to service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Keyci

texts.es: Keyci de 24 años de edad  vive en la ciudad de Cartagena, lugar donde tiene su propio negocio de vender carnes frías y productos de aseo. Su negocio lo inició una vez dejó de trabajar con un empresario que comercializa estos productos y con quien adquirió su experiencia.  Así fue como  hace 1 año emprendió su propia aventura de negocio independiente, teniendo el apoyo del empresario con quien trabajaba, pues él le daba los productos a consignación. Con   sus ahorros, generados por sus ganancias,  logró tener su propio capital y hoy compra directamente, pero en épocas de mucho movimiento comercial, como la navidad y la llegada del nuevo año, las ventas se incrementan y es cuando su capital de trabajo, se torna insuficiente para responder a la demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará carnes frías, embutidos, productos de belleza, desinfectantes y ropa que tiene encargados por sus clientes y que le permiten tener en su negocio un buen surtido. Su sueño es hacerlo crecer, para aumentar sus ingresos y en el futuro tener su casa propia y ofrecerle una buena educación a su  hijo que tiene 8 meses de nacido.
texts.en:
Keyci, 24, lives in the city of Cartagena where she has her business selling cold cuts and cleaning supplies.  She started her business when she stopped working for a businessman who also sells these products and where she gained her experience.  

A year ago, then, she started her own adventure as an independent business with support from that businessman she used to work for because he’d give her products on consignment.  With savings generated from her profits she managed to have her own capital and today she buys directly but during seasons of high commercial activity, like Christmas and New Year, her working capital is insufficient to meet demand.

This is the reason behind her Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy cold cuts, canned goods, beauty products, disinfectants and clothes she has customer prior orders for so that she can have a well-stocked business.  Her dream is to make it grow to increase income and in future have a house of her own and to provide her 8-month-old son with a good education.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store and clothes she has standing orders for.

loans.name: Shirley Gabriela

texts.es:
Shirley de 22 años, es una joven emprendedora que tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que es vendedora de adornos y carteras. Comenzó su negocio trabajando con la mama ahora ella tiene sus propias ventas. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones de independizarse a su totalidad por eso trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano. Quiere continuar haciendo manualidades ya que le ha generado unos ingresos rentables. 

Quiere el préstamo para comprar carteras y materiales para hacer manualidades y poder hacer adornos para una venta con mas calidad. En el futuro quiere mejorar su casa y terminar de construir su negocio.
texts.en:
Shirley, 22, is a young entrepreneur with many hopes for her business; she sells decorations and purses.  She started the business working with her mother but now she has her own sales. 

She very much wants to become totally independent and this is why she works every day starting very early.  She wants to continue to make crafts since they have produced good profits for her.

She wants the loan to buy purses and materials for her crafts to make higher quality decorations to sell.  In the future she wants to improve her house and finish building her business.

loans.use: to buy purses and crafts-making supplies.

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es: Rubén Darío es padre de 2 hijos y se dedica al corte de madera en varias veredas de Santa Elena al oriente de Antioquia. Realiza esta actividad desde que la aprendió de manera empírica y desde entonces es gracias a esta que ha conseguido el sustento de sus hijos. Actualmente su producción es muy baja debido a que la aserradora con la que trabaja se encuentra en mal estado, es por esto que requiere de la compra de una aserradora nueva que le permita aumentar su productividad, le genere mayores ingresos y pueda contribuir más al desarrollo de sus hijos. Rubén Darío sueña con tener su propio taller donde tenga todas las máquinas adecuadas para el corte de la madera y poder ofrecer a sus clientes el servicio completo. También sueña con poder brindar a sus hijos la educación que necesitan y permitirles progresar con una economía estable en su hogar.
texts.en:
Rubén Darío is the father of two children.  He works sawing wood in various settlements in Santa Elena in eastern Antioquia.  He has been in this occupation since he taught himself how to do it and since then it’s been thanks to it that he’s earned sustenance for his children.

Production is currently very low because the saw he works with is in bad condition and this is why he needs to buy a new one that will make it possible for him to increase production and generate higher income to contribute more towards his children’s development.

Rubén Darío dreams with having his own shop with all the necessary machinery to cut wood and offer his customers a more complete service.  He also dreams with being able to provide his children with the education they need and allow them to progress within a stable economic situation at home.

loans.use: to buy a new saw.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra, es  una joven  muy emprendedora y responsable, actualmente  ella  trabaja  por  las  mañanas  y  en las  noches  estudia  en la  universidad,  ella  se acerco a la institución ya  que  nos  comenta  que desea  pagar   su colegiatura  semestral, esta  muy  contenta  de  habernos  encontrado  ya  que  gracias  al apoyo  podrá  continuar sus  estudios y  en poco  tiempo  lograra  concluir  con su mayor  sueño el cual es convertirse  en  una licenciada.
texts.en: Sandra is a responsible, very enterprising young woman.  She currently works in the morning and attends University at night.  She called on the Institution because she tells us that she wants to pay her semester’s tuition.  She’s very happy to have found us because thanks to the support she’ll get she will be able to continue with her studies and shortly reach her greatest dream which is to become a lawyer.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Reynaldo Antonio

texts.es: Reynaldo Antonio es un cliente de Fundación León 2000, tiene una actividad económica que es la renta de apartamentos en el cual este negocio que el emprendió fue por necesidad de generar ingresos a la familia pero al pasar de los años se enamoro de este negocio y hoy en día le dedica mucha dedicación y sus clientes están satisfecho por su servicio que le brinda. Actualmente Reynaldo está solicitando financiamiento para comprar sabanas, colchones, entre otros arreglos necesarios para los apartamentos que renta.
texts.en: Reynaldo Antonio is a Fundación León 2000 client whose economic activity is renting out apartments; he started this business because he needed to generate family income but in time he fell in love with this business and today he is very dedicated to it and his customers are satisfied because of the service he provides.  Reynaldo at present is requesting a loan to buy sheets and mattresses among other necessary décor items for the apartments he rents out.

loans.use: to buy sheets and mattresses, among other items.

loans.name: Los Portales De Igualapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama los portales de igualapa; la historia es acerca de la señora Agustina cuenta con 33 años de edad y está casada con el señor Manuel González quien es albañil, tienen 2 hijos Antonio y José Luis los cuales cursan segundo año de prepa y segundo año de secundaria, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan con la cual lleva más de 20 años.

Ella decidió iniciar con este negocio porque quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, al igual que para  mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, el préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas material como son: huevos, manteca, azúcar, harina, levadura, canela, etc. Y así continuar elaborando su rico pan.

Doña agustina está muy contenta porque dice que le esta yendo muy bien con su negocio, ya que sus ventas han incrementado bastante al igual que sus clientes e ingresos, tanto que hasta está ahorrando para asegurar la educación de sus hijos.

La meta que tiene doña tina (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad) es la de continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios para que puedan terminar una buena carrera profesional y así tengan un mejor futuro, también quiere hacer crecer mas su pequeño negocio, ya que quiere construir un local para poner su panadería y así mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.

Esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y los prestatatarios de kiva por el apoyo incondicional que le están brindando, ya que gracias a esta ayuda ha mejorado su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Estos son los nombres de las personas y las actividades a las que se dedican cada una de las integrantes del grupo los portales de igualapa.
Agustina, Marisol, minerva y Celia quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: abarrotes, venta de cosméticos, tamales y panadería.
texts.en:
This group is Los Portales de Igualapa (Gates of Igualapa). This story is about Mrs. Agustina, who is 33 years old and married to Mr. Manuel González, a mason. They have two children: Antonio and José Luis, who are in their second year of studies in high school and junior high. She has worked baking and selling bread for more than 20 years.

She decided to start this business because she wanted to look for a way to help her sons get ahead and support her husband with the expenses of the home. She also wanted to improve her family's quality of life. She used the loan to invest in the purchase of eggs, lard, sugar, flour, yeast, cinnamon, and more, in order to keep baking her delicious bread.

Agustina is very happy because she says her business is going very well, and that her sales have increased a lot, as well as her customers and income, so much so that she is saving to provide for her sons' education. The goal of Doña Tina (as she is better known in her community) is to continue supporting her sons with their studies so that they can get professional careers and have a better future. She also wants to grow her small business by building a bakery and increasing her earnings. She is thankful to the Fundación Realidad and the Kiva lenders for the unconditional support they are giving her. Thanks to this help, she has improved her quality of life and that of her family.

These are the names of the Portales de Igualapa group members and the jobs they do: Agustina, Marisol, Minerva and Celia, who work at different jobs such as selling groceries and cosmetics, tamales, and a bakery.

loans.use: purchase eggs, lard, sugar, flour, yeast, cinnamon, etc.

loans.name: Fatima Group

texts.en:
In the photo are the members of the “Fatima” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Memunatu. Memunatu is age thirty-nine; she was born in Port Loko town but she is currently residing in Waterloo, together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. For fifteen years now, Memunatu has been selling clothes. With this loan, she will buy clothes wholesale to add to her business inventory.


(Also included on the left of the photo is loan officer Edna B.Konteh, handing over the loan amount to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale prices to add to her business stock.

loans.name: Tatasia Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tatasia” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 4,800,000 SLL for the entire group in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Mabinty is the leader of this group. Mabinty is thirty-six years old and married with three children. Mabinty sells market food – palm oil, rice, etc. She has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Mabinty will invest in her business by buying palm oil and rice wholesale to add to her business.

(Also included on the left of the photo is loan officer Edna B. Conteh, handing over the loan amount to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy palm oil and rice wholesale to add to her business stock.

loans.name: Na God Da Gee Group

texts.en:
Aminata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Aminata was born in Magburaka town, about forty-five years ago. She is married and together she and her husband have four children.

For many years now, Aminata has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), cassava leaves, paper, etc. Aminata and her group members have applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for each in order to improve on the size and quality of their respective businesses. 

Aminata is going to use her share of the loan to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock. 


(Also included on the left of the photo is loan officer, Edna B. Konteh, handing over the loan amount to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy palm oil, cassava leaves, paper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Way Forward Group

texts.en:
Aminata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Aminata was born in Kambia town, about  forty-eight years ago. She is married to a salaried worker and the couple have three children who are attending secondary schools. Aminata sells used clothes and has been doing this business for over twenty years now. 

With the help of this loan, Aminata and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Aminata will use her share of the loan (2,000,000 SLL) to buy used clothes in large quantity to add to her current stock.


(Also included on the left of the photo is loan officer Kadiatu Bah, handing over the loan amount to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy used clothes in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, él administra una ladrillera, alquila un lote de terreno para instalar el negocio, elabora ladrillos, bloques y teja, de este negocio logra mantener a su familia y cubrir sus necesidades.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de arena y cemento, ya que son los materiales necesarios para elaborar los productos,  esto fortalecerá el negocio y le brindara mayor seguridad.
La aspiración de José es que su familia cuente con una casa propia, para estar más cómodos y en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and three children. He manages a brickyard. José rents a plot of land where his business is located. He produces bricks, blocks, and tiles. This business helps to support his family and cover their needs.

He is requesting a loan to buy sand and cement. These materials are necessary for manufacturing his products, strengthening his business, and providing more security. José’s aspiration is to see his family live in their own home so that they can be more comfortable and have better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sand and cement for making bricks, blocks, and tiles.

loans.name: Cecilia Maria

texts.es:
Cecilia de 28 años de edad, es una mujer casada y junto a su esposo tienen 3 preciosos hijos a los cuales adora mucho. Ella y su familia viven actualmente en casa de los padres de su esposo, quienes le han brindado gentilmente un espacio para tener su negocio y pueda salir adelante como familia; Cecilia tiene una bodega, en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, arroz, azúcar, leche, enlatados, entre otros, ella lleva aproximadamente trabajando en su negocio desde hace 8 años, los que han sido de lucha constante y de perseverancia, tuvo la idea de tener este negocio debido a que en su ciudad se viene trabajando un proyecto, el cual consiste en transportar gas a través de unos tubos que pasan por diversas ciudades del sur del Perú, a raíz de ello habían muchas personas que laboran en este proyecto y necesitaban comprar productos de primera necesidad y es por ello que se animó a tener este negocio, también influyó que en los alrededores de su casa no se encontra ninguna otra bodega.

Cecilia  se ha esforzado mucho por salir adelante, antes de tener su negocio ella trabajaba como empleada del hogar, luego se dedico a la agricultura, a su vez su esposo logro ingresar al proyecto de transporte de gas como operario y no solo eso, desde entonces juntaron dinero para tener un negocio, al cual actualmente se dedica Cecilia, ella cree que le está logrando sus objetivos en el negocio por el buen trato que brinda a los clientes y porque tiene variedad en los productos que ofrece, pero sobre todo por su carisma que brinda en la atención.

Cecilia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que se le brindará, ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio y también remodelará su negocio, con esta mejora tendrá mas ingresos y su negocio se verá mucho más atractivo para los clientes, estos nuevos y mejores ingresos le permitiran ahorrar y cumplir su gran sueño: "Hacer de sus hijo unos profesionales de éxito"
texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Cecilia is a married woman.  She and her husband have three beautiful children she adores.  She and her family currently live in her husband's parents' home.  They generously offered her a space for her business so they can all get ahead as a family.  Cecilia has a small grocery store in which she sells necessities such as groceries, rice, sugar, milk, and canned goods, among other things.  She has had her business for eight years and those years have been full of constant struggle and perseverance.  She got the idea to start this business because there is a construction project going on in her city to transport gas in tubes that pass through different cities in the south of Peru.  Because of this, there have been many people working on the project who needed to buy necessities and that is why she decided to set up this business.  She was also influenced by the fact that there isn't another grocery store near her house.

Cecilia has worked very hard to get ahead; before starting her business, she worked as a maid, then she worked in agriculture.  As far as her husband is concerned, he managed to get work in the gas transport project as a laborer.  What's more, from that moment they put money aside to start a business and that business is the one Cecilia currently has.  She believes that she is achieving her business goals because of her good customer service and because she offers variety in the products she carries, but most of all because of her charisma when helping customers.

Cecilia is very thankful to be a Kiva borrower because thanks to the support she will receive, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business and she will also remodel it.  With these improvements, she will make more income and her business will look much more attractive for her customers.  This new, better income will allow her to save and achieve her greatest dream, which is to make her children successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to remodel her small grocery store

loans.name: Claudia Licenia

texts.es: A sus 23 años, la joven Claudia Licenia desea iniciar su propio negocio de café Internet con servicios de computación y venta de comida. Esta idea surgió de la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos a la vez que puede dedicarle tiempo de cuidado a su bebé de apenas 6 meses de nacido. Para terminar de completar lo que requiere para el inicio de su negocio, la señora Claudia Licenia necesita de la compra de una vitrina, un congelar y surtido de snacks para adecuar su local. A futuro la joven Claudia Licenia sueña con ver crecer a su hijo y brindarle una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en: At the age of 23, Claudia Licenia wants to start her own Internet café offering computers services and selling food. She came up with this idea out of the need to earn an income of her own as well as to be able to dedicate herself to care for her 6-months-old baby. In order to have what she needs to start her activity, Claudia Licenia needs to buy a showcase, a freezer to accessorize her shop and snacks to supply it. In the future, young Claudia Licenia wishes to see her child grow up to offer him a good standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a showcase, a freezer and snacks to start her activity.

loans.name: El Campo De Huixtepec Group

texts.es:
Esta  historia es sobre la señora Florentina, ya que es la representante de este grupo llamado "El campo de Huixtepec", ella cuenta con 54 años de edad y está casada con el señor Maximino quien es campesino, tienen 7 hijos de los cuales solo Arturo estudia cursa el sexto año de primaria, ya que los otros 6 están casados, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa artesanal, como vestidos, blusas, servilletas y manteles, desde hace mas de 30 años.

Dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa e hijo con sus estudios, y así mismo gozar de una mejor solvencia económica y excelente calidad de vida, aparte de que dice desde pequeña su mama le enseño a bordar, es por eso que decidió empezar con esta actividad, el préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir, en la compra de mas material como son: telas, cuadrille, hilos, agujas, armazones y chaquira, para continuar con sus ventas.


Doña flor (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad)  dice que su meta es la de hacer que su negocio crezca empresarialmente, ya que quiere construir un local puesto que lo que más desea es poner su tienda de ropa artesanal y así dar a conocer un poco de lo que hacen en su comunidad, también para de esta forma tenerlo bien surtido, con más variedad de prendas, y así obtener más y mejores ganancias.  

Da las gracias a FRAC y a los prestatarios de kiva por darle la oportunidad y confianza, pero sobre todo por creer en ella, ya que gracias a su ayuda pudo invertir en su negocio y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida, junto con su familia y un mejor futuro.

Las personas que conforman el grupo de "El campo de Huixtepec" son las siguientes: victoria, florentina, Carmela y etelvina, quienes se dedican a la elaboración y venta de ropa artesanal.
texts.en:
This story is about Florentina who is the representative of a group called “El Campo de Huixtepec.” She’s 54 years old and married to Maximino who is a farmer; they have seven children but only Arturo who is in sixth grade still lives with them, the other six are married.  She makes and sells traditional, artisanal clothes like dresses, blouses, napkins and tablecloths; she’s been doing this for more than 30 years.

She says she decided to go into this business because she wanted to find a way to help her husband cover household expenses and costs of their son’s schooling as well as enjoy better economic solvency and an excellent quality of life.  Besides, she says that since she was a little girl her mother taught her how to embroider so this is why she decided to start this business.  The loan she got will be used to buy more supplies like fabric, quadrille, thread, needles, embroidery hoops and beads to continue with her sales.

Doña Flor (as she’s better known in her community) says that her goal is to make her business grow businesswise because she wants to build a locale because what she wants most is to open her artisanal clothing store so that what they do in her community will become better known and also to have it well-stocked this way with more articles of clothing to earn better profits.

She thanks FRAC and Kiva lenders for giving her the opportunity and for trusting her but, above all, for believing in her, because thanks to your help she was able to invest in her business and have a better quality of life with her family and a better future.

The people who form the “El Campo de Huixtepec” group are the following: Victoria, Florentina, Carmela and Etelvina who manufacture and sell artisanal clothing.

loans.use: to buy clothes making supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes making supplies.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan se dedica hace varios años al servicio de gomería,  en avenidas céntricas de la ciudad de Cochabamba ofrece los servicios de parchado , vulcanizado y aire para neumáticos tanto para coches como para motos desde las 8 am hasta las 10pm , el es soltero pero colabora en los gastos de luz y de agua en su hogar vive en la casa de sus padres quienes también le colaboran con la alimentación, su meta es expandir el negocio y independizarse no solo financieramente sino tener su propio hogar, es un joven emprendedor con ganas de superación, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de herramientas y material que usa para la reparación de llantas.
texts.en:
For the past several years, Juan has managed a tire shop located along one the central avenues in the city of Cochabamba. He offers patches, vulcanization, and air for tires used on automobiles and motorcycles. Juan works from 8am to 10pm. He is single, but he lives at his parents’ house and contributes toward the electricity and water expenses. Juan also shares in the food expenses.

His goal is to expand his business and become financially independent. He would also like to have a home of his own. This young entrepreneur has the desire to succeed. The money from this loan will be used to buy tools and supplies for repairing tires.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies for repairing tires.

loans.name: Sindy Julieth

texts.es: Sindy Julieth es una joven de 20 años que recibió el negocio de abarrotes de la tradición familiar. Sus abuelos empezaron con el negocio vendiendo abarrotes básicos como el mercado; a medida que ha ido creciendo el negocio se ha ido surtiendo poco a poco, y ahora que Sindy Julieth lo tiene a su cargo lo quiere diversificar aún mas vendiendo licor, snack y dulcería. Sindy Julieth sueña con poder hacer crecer el negocio y poder vender en el ropa, accesorios en general entre otras cosas, así podrá cubrir mejor sus gastos, mejorando sus ingresos y aumentando el nivel de su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sindy Julieth, 20, continues the family tradition of having a general store.  Her grandparents opened the business selling basic products like a market does.  The store grew little by little as more merchandise was added.  Now that she is in charge she wants to diversify even more by selling liquors, snacks and sweets.  
Sindy Julieth dreams of expanding her business and being able to sell clothing, accessories and more.  That way she can better cover her expenses, increase her income and raise her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as liquors, snacks and sweets for her general store

loans.name: Laurita Claidina

texts.es:
Laurita de 54 años es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio de venta de comida hace ya dos años atrás. Empezó su negocio con la ayuda de un amigo en la cocina, poco a poco fue teniendo clientela hasta ahora que ya tiene clientes fijos. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere mejorar los desayunos y almuerzos que vendes. Comienza su horario de trabajo desde las 06h00am hasta las 16h00. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar y carnes para preparar mas platos. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
