El señor Faustino quiere el préstamo para la compra de semillas y siembra de maíz y para lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, sus productos lo comercializa en el mercado de la zona directamente del productor al consumidor El esta agradecido con el préstamo que emprender le esta dando ya que esta es su única actividad para mantenerse y salir adelante.
texts.en: Mr. Faustino lives alone and has lived in the Espejitos neighborhood, part of the Porongo municipality for over 50 years. He has been in the agriculture and cattle raising fields for some 25 years, he grows corn, yucca, rice, coffee and citric fruits and takes care of his cattle. Mr. Faustino wants a loan to buy seeds, corn crops and all the items needed to prepare the soil, his products are sold in the market directly from producer to consumer. He is grateful with the loan that Emprender is giving him since this is his only source of income and way to get ahead in life.

loans.use: buy seeds for his corn crops.

loans.name: Ana Agustina

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, viven en casa propia, ella se dedica a una pupuseria, tiene más de 6 años en el negocio, lo administra en su casa, lo inicio por su esposo.
Actualmente ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de sodas, jugos, aceite, condimentos, maíz, para la preparación de las pupusas, ya que estos materiales son los primordiales para fortalecerse y mejorar la atención a los clientes.
La aspiración de Ana es mejorar y crecer con sus ventas, ya que con estos ingresos apoya a sus hijos y a su esposo, para cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and three children; they live in their own home. She has worked in a pupuseria (a place that makes pupusas, thick corn patties filled with meats, cheese, refried beans, pork rinds or other foodstuffs) that was started by her husband and she has worked on it for some 6 years in her home.

At present, Ana needs a loan to buy refreshments, juices, oil, spices and corn, prepare the pupusas since these are the main ingredients for her product that will strengthen and improve her standing with her customers.

Ana’s dream is to improve and see her sales grow since her income helps her support her children and husband to meet all of the families’ expenses.

loans.use: buy refreshments, juices, oil, spices, corn, cheese and fried crackling.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 41 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ahuaycha, anexo de Puruhuay. Ella se caracteriza por se runa persona alegra y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Así lo demuestra con el cuidado de sus animales entre ellos, ovejas y vacas. Su objetivo es engordarlas y venderlas a un mayor precio; ya que de esa manera obtiene mayores ganancias. Además gracias a los terrenos agrícolas que compró con mucho esfuerzo puede sembrar; papa y maíz en grandes cantidades. “Es mi especialidad”, afirma. Pues los comerciantes mayoristas la buscan, en cada cosecha para comprar sus alimentos, que son de buena calidad. Ahora ella desea incrementar su producción, por lo que ahorrará para obtener más terrenos agrícolas. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “señor de puruhuay” y este es el tercer préstamo con MFP, donde está muy contenta pues tendrá, apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Julia, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos de papa y maíz.
texts.en: Julia is 41 years old and is a very hardworking woman, she lives with her 3 children whom she takes care of in her own home located in Ahuaycha part of Puruhuay. She is characterized for being a very happy person with a lot of enthusiasm to get ahead in life. She shows her vivacity by the care she gives to her animals, among them sheep and cows. Her goal is to fatten them up and sell them at a higher price since she can have more earnings. Thanks to the agricultural land that she bought with a lot of hard work she is able to grow potatoes and corn in large quantities. “That’s my specialty,” Julia says since the wholesalers seek her out every harvest season to buy her food since they are of good quality. Julia now wishes to increase her production which is why she will save to have more agricultural land. Julia is a part of the Communal Bank “The Lord of Puruhuay,” this is her third loan with MFP where she is very happy since she has financial support and feels secure in growing her business. She is committed to meeting all of her payment quotas and is grateful for being part of her communal bank since all of the members are responsible and unified. When receiving your support, Julia will use the money to buy natural fertilizers to spread over her potato and corn crops.

loans.use: buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Glenda Maricela

texts.es:
Glenda, es soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos, se dedica a la venta de riguas, atol y además ropa, lleva tres años en el negocio, vende ropa por las mañanas de 8:00am a 1:00pm, por las tardes ofrece los antojitos como el atol y riguas desde las 3:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa interior, este crédito le ayudara para mejorar el negocio, ya que obtendrá más mercadería de nuevos estilos para los clientes.
Los sueños de Glenda es mantenerse en el negocio e ir creciendo poco a poco, logrando experiencia para poder ayudar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Glenda is single and lives with her parents and brothers. She sells riguas (corn patties cooked on a banana leaf), atol (cornstarch hot drink) and clothing. She has been in the business for three years, and sells her clothing in the mornings from 8:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. and in the afternoons she sells her treats like atol and riguas from 3:00 p.m.

Glenda needs the loan to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and underwear; this loan will help her improve the business since she will have more merchandize in new fashions for her customers.

Glenda’s dreams are to keep her businesses, and grow little by little and gaining experience to be able to help her parents.

loans.use: buy pants, shirts, blouses, and underwear.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a taxi driver in NYC. He has had five previous loans from Kiva partner Accion USA, all of which helped sustain his business by paying for regular repairs for his car. He has been offered lines of credit with other organizations, but turned them down because he is happy with Accion USA. In the future, he hopes to continue building his business.
This loan will be used to help pay off Juan’s vehicle insurance, and pay for a few repairs (brakes, windshield wipers, side mirror and back window) done on his car.

loans.use: to pay for car insurance and repairs.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María, originaria de  Granada, de oficio comerciante nos comenta el cambio que ha representado para el préstamo recibido de Kiva, el cual utilizo para  compra de mercadería en general tales como sandalias, chinela de baño, también invirtió en verduras  y granos básicos como arroz para vender esto le permitió a ella ampliar su negocio con productos que antes no tenia, esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le fue concedida. Ahora ella solicita un crédito nuevamente para compra de  arroz, verduras y zapatos para vender y seguir con sus sueños de salir adelante  y superarse cada día.
texts.en: Maria, originally from Granada, who works as a seller, tells us of the change that the loan she received from Kiva has represented for her. She used this loan to buy merchandise such as sandals and bath slippers, and she also invested in vegetables and basic grains like rice to sell which permitted her to enlarge her business with products she didn't have before. She is very grateful for the opportunity that she was granted. Now she is asking for a new loan to buy rice, vegetables and shoes to sell and continue with her dreams of getting ahead and improving herself every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables and shoes to sell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa, de 37 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Marcial, con quien tiene 3 hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ahuaycha. Tranquila y con buen semblante, se muestra Luisa. Pues cuenta que su principal actividad económica es la ganadería, cría vacas de buena raza, que le brindan la leche necesaria para la elaboración de quesos. Los cuales lo comercializan en la feria que se realiza todos los domingos en la ciudad de Pampas, donde ella baja para obtener buenas ganancias. Mientra que los demás días de la semana, vende la leche por litros; ya que los habitantes del caserío le solicitan. Pero como buena mujer del campo, también siembra papa, alverja y maíz; para su consumo propio. No obstante en temporadas de siembra grande, comercializa su producción para a baja escala. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “señor de puruhuay” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde está muy contenta pues tendrá, apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Luisa, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
Luisa, 37, is a hard-working woman.  She lives with her husband, Marcial and they have three children who all live in their own house in Ahuaycha.  Luisa is easy-going and healthy.  She tells us that her main business is cattle and she raises a good breed of cows that give enough milk to make cheese.  She sells the cheese in the Sunday market of Pampas where she works to make good money.  The other days of the week she sells milk by the liter to the other residents of the village who request it.  But as a good country woman she also plants potatoes, beans and corn for the family.  Nevertheless when she has big harvest, she sells the crop but on a small scale. 

She belongs to the “Señor de Puruhuay” communal bank and this is her third loan with MFP.  She is very happy that she will have financial support since she feels more confident that she can advance her business.  She also promises to make all her payments on time and she is grateful to be part of the association where all the members are responsible and united.
Luisa will use her requested money to buy balanced food for her animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced food for her animals

loans.name: Yeison Ramiro

texts.es: A sus 20 años, el joven Yeison Ramiro trabaja desde hace un año como vendedor y distribuidor de arepas en una fabrica de su familia donde se elabora y vende a las diferentes tiendas y restaurantes este producto. Con la esperanza de mejorar sus ventas y aumentar la producción de la fabrica que ha disminuido en los últimos meses por falta de capital de trabajo, el joven Yeison Ramiro necesita de la compra de insumos como maíz, carbón y bolsas con lo cual puedan sus familiares elaborar el producto y él poderlo distribuir. El sueño del joven Yeison Ramiro es ampliar la fabrica y poder generar empleos directos.
texts.en:
Yeison Ramiro is a young 20 year old man working for the last year selling and distributing arepas (Colombian corn tortillas) in a family business where he makes and sells this product to the different stores and restaurants. 

With the hope of improving his sales and increasing the amount of tortillas being made, which has been decreasing in the last months due to the lack of working capital, young Yeison Ramiro needs to buy supplies such as corn, charcoal, and bags with which his relatives can make the food and distribute it. 

The dream that the young Yeison Ramior has is to expand the business and to be able to create direct jobs.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make corn tortillas such as corn

loans.name: Senia

texts.en:
Senia, 32 years of age, is married and has three children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Senia needs a loan of WST 2,500 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 800 WST or US $333 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Senia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Senia's 5th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Kakha

texts.en:
Kakha is 29-years-old. He lives in the village Koda with his family: wife – Ketevan and two children (4-years-old daughter and 11-months-old son).

Kakha works in his own car workshop where he provides a car repairing service to drivers from his and nearby villages. He provides various types of services to customers. Kakha requested credit for to perform a renovation of his workshop. He will also purchase new equipment. With the new equipment and renovated workshop, Kakha will attract new customers and increase his income. Kakha plans to save his income in the future for further development of his business. He plans to open a car washing box next to the workshop which will have significant positive influence on family’s income. The family will be able to renovate and equip their newly purchased house with the increased income.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his car repair workshop renovation.

loans.name: Edison Arley

texts.es: Edison Arley es un joven de 19 años que quiere emprender el negocio que ha heredado su familia por largas generaciones. Edison se dedica al cuidado de abejas y la extracción de su miel para la venta, actividad que le enseñó su padre cuando apenas tenía 8 años y que ha desarrollado desde entonces, hasta el día de hoy cuando decide ampliar el apiario que le regalo su padre. Edison sueña con tener un gran negocio de mieles donde sea reconocido por su excelente calidad, además de poder pagar los gastos de sus padres y que mejoren su calidad de vida. Sin embargo, por las fuertes lluvias, las flores no han crecido lo suficiente para poder abastecer de alimento las abejas, por lo que se les debe complementar con azúcar, por esto, Edison requiere de la compra de alimento para sus abejas y los recursos para ampliar el apiario actual.
texts.en: Edison Arley is a young 19-year-old who wants to keep running the business that his family has passed down for generations. Edison is a beekeeper and extracts their honey for sale. His father taught him this business when he was barely 8 years old and he has worked on the business since then. He now wants to expand the collection of beehives that his father gave him. Edison dreams of having a large honey business and of being known for the high quality of his honey, along with being able to cover his parents' costs and improve their quality of life. However, because of the strong rains, the flowers have not grown enough to keep the bees fed; for this reason, Edison has to supplement their diet with sugar. In order to do this, Edison needs to buy food for his bees, as well as tools to expand his current collection of beehives.

loans.use: to feed the bees in his beehives and to expand his current collection of beehives.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo que se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de la ciudad de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su  artesanía como los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 23 y 22 años de edad, ambos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer. Nuestra amiga es artesana hace varios años, estuvo en una academia de corte y confección en la cual aprendió muy bien esta profesión.

Ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa lugar donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que requieren de sus servicios, además también vende ropa de todo tipo la cual lo realiza puerta a puerta aunque le mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su propio taller. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar. Lleva más de 10 años dedicada a estas actividades y le va bastante bien.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito con la finalidad de seguir adelante en su negocio ya que con los créditos se financia y continua adelante, nos cuenta que le fue muy bien con el crédito anterior y que obtuvo muy buenas ganancias, con lo cual no tuvo atrasos en los pagos.
 
Ella realiza este nuevo crédito para comprar ropa de todo tipo para vender esta mercadería en este mes que es muy bueno. Para ella los créditos son tan importantes ya que a través  de ellos ha mejorado su negocio y su vida en familia. Esta desde el inicio en el banco comunal y le gusta porque la institución es muy seria y confiable.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su vida diaria y mejorar con el paso de los días.
texts.en:
The “Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo” (“With Love and Faith Towards Development”) communal bank meets every two weeks in Los Bajos in the city of Montecristi, a city known for its cultural riches and for its artisan work such as the Panama hat, known both throughout the country and outside of it.

In this place we meet Ana, 45 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has two children, 22 and 23 years old. Both of them live with her. Her husband is a driver. Our friend has been an artisan for several years. She went to a sewing and dressmaking academy, where she learned this profession very well.

She has a small dressmaking shop in her house, where she has sewn clothes for many years. She works based on orders from particular people who need her services. She also sells all kinds of clothing, which she does door-to-door, although most of her sales take place in her own shop. She works every day from 6:00am until 10:00pm, and sometimes later when she has orders to deliver. She has been doing this work for more than 10 years, and it’s going pretty well for her.

She is taking out another loan with the goal of moving forward in her business, since with the loans she finances herself and continues moving forward. She tells us that the previous loan went very well for her and she obtained very good earnings, and she had no delays in making the repayments.

She is taking out this new loan in order to purchase clothing of all kinds to sell this month, which is a very good one. For her, the loans are so important, since through them she has improved her business and her family’s life. She has been a member of the communal bank from the beginning, and she likes it because the institution is very serious and reliable.

Her dreams are to continue moving forward in her daily life and to improve with the passing of time.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Celso Noel

texts.es:
Celso, es soltero vive con su madre y su hermana, él tiene en su casa un taller de bicicletas, lo comenzó por iniciativa propia, no tiene un horario establecido y ya tiene experiencia en el negocio.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar los repuestos como: rines, bombas, llantas, tubos y parches, solo a si teniendo lo necesario podrá darles un buen servicio a sus clientes y los ingresos mejoraran cada día.
El sueño de Celso es mejorar su taller y tener los repuestos necesarios para mejorar su negocio y ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Celso is single, lives with his mother and sister, he has in his home a bicycle workshop that he began by his own initiative. He has no set hours and has experience in the business.

The loan will be used to buy spare parts like: rims, pumps, tires, tubes, and patches to give his customers good service and improve his income each day.

Celso’s dream is to improve his workshop and have the necessary spare parts to improve his business and help his family with the household expenses.

loans.use: buy rims, pumps, tires, tubes, and patches.

loans.name: Edwin Arcides

texts.es:
Edwin, vive con su familia en casa familiar, el tiene su taller de reparación de vehículos y luego los vende, el oficio lo inicio hace 4 años lo heredo de su padre no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar repuestos para la reparación de vehículos como: llantas, vidrios, asientos, pintura de esa forma podrá lograr tener los vehículos en buenas condiciones y venderlos a buen precio lo que permitirá cubrir otros gastos que tiene en su familia.
El sueño de Edwin  es siempre mantener su negocio y de esa forma podrá cada día obtener mejores ganancias y ayudar siempre a su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin lives with his family in his home and has an auto repair shop, he later sells the vehicles. He began his work 4 years ago as he inherited it from his father. Edwin has no set hours.

The loan will be used to buy spare parts to repair vehicles like: tires, glass, seats, and paint. This will allow him to keep the cars in good condition and be able to sell them at a good price which will allow him to meet his families’ expenses.

Edwin’s dreams are to always keep his business, have more earnings each day and to always help his family.

loans.use: buy tires, glass, seats, and paint.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: Don Jose, de 45 años quien habita en la ciudad de Granada , de oficio comerciante , se dedica  a la venta de queso al detalle actividad que realiza de manera ambulante desde hace dos años. El vende a las pulperías, casas tocando puerta a puerta para ofrecer sus quesos frescos y sabrosa crema de leche aunque la lucha ha sido dura ha sido un guerrero incansable en su caminar para salir adelante con su negocio todo sacrificio para que a su familia no le falte nada y puedan vivir mejor. El requiere un segundo crédito para compra de queso y crema. Este es su segundo crédito pues el primero fue muy positivo para su negocio ya que logro mejorar sus ventas y espera que este segundo le vaya aun mejor.
texts.en: Don Jose, age 45, lives in the city of Granada. He is a merchant and sells cheese door-to-door; he has been doing this for two years. He sells his fresh cheese and flavourful cream to grocery stores and homes. Times have been tough but he has worked without tiring in order to get ahead with his business. He has made many sacrifices so that his family will not lack for anything and will have a better quality of life. He needs a second loan for the purchase of cheese and cream. This is his second loan; the first was very good for his business because he was able to improve his sales. He hopes that this second loan goes even better.

loans.use: to buy cheese and cream.

loans.name: Tagisia

texts.en:
Tagisia, 50 years old, is married and has three children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business.  Tagisia needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 WST or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Tagisia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Tagisia's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Jessica Paola

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo que se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de la ciudad de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su artesanía como  los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jessica, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 7 y 1 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es artesano.

Ella es maestra en un jardín de infantes particular, pero para ayudar a su esposo realiza los créditos para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, él se dedica a elaborar artesanías hechas en tagua y elabora infinidad de productos en su taller, artículos que luego los entrega terminados  a comerciantes que llegan hasta su taller para luego llevarlos a otras ciudades donde son vendidos al público en general. Su esposo lleva más de 7 años dedicado a este arte y gracias a Dios no le falta trabajo ya que tiene su clientela asegurada por el buen trabajo que realiza.

Este crédito es para comprar tagua para elaborar estos productos. Lleva más de tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les dan con los créditos.

Sus sueños son tener un nombramiento en una escuela o colegio y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo" ["With Love and Faith Toward Development"] meets every 15 days in Los Bajos in the city of Montecristi. This city is known for its cultural richness and for its handicrafts, such as the famous hats made from toquilla fibers ["Panama" hats], which are known both within the country and abroad. 

In this place, we meet Jessica, who is 24 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has two children, aged 7 and 1. The older child is in school. Her husband is an artisan. 

Jessica is a teacher in a private preschool, but to help her husband, she is taking out the loans so that he can use the funds for his work. He dedicates himself to making handicrafts from tagua [ivory palm nuts]. He makes an infinite variety of products in his workshop, and he delivers the finished items to merchants who come to his workshop to take the merchandise to other cities, where they are sold to the public. Her husband has dedicated himself to this art for more than 7 years, and "thanks to God," she reports, he has not lacked for work, since he has a steady clientele thanks to the excellent quality of his work. 

This loan will be used to buy tagua to create these products. Jessica has been in the communal bank for more than three years, and she likes it because of the help the members receive with the loans.

Her dreams are to have a permanent position in a primary or secondary school, and to provide the best possible support to her children.

loans.use: to buy tagua [ivory palm nuts].

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for installing electricity in his house

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 36 años es un responsable padre de familia. Vive en compañía de su esposa Dora, con quien vive desde hace 17 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Sherly y Maricielo; a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Trancapampa. El trabajo al que se dedica en las mañanas, consiste en el mantenimiento de carreteras; pues las lluvias deterioran el paso de los autos, con lodo. Gracias a este trabajo adquiere un dinero extra, ya que recibe un sueldo mensual de parte del gobierno de su localidad. Pero su principal actividad económica es la ganadería. Cuenta con 7 vacas, de buena calidad; las que le brindan leche; que utiliza para la elaboración de quesos pequeños o llamados “bolillos”. Además, los comerciantes de leche fresca, compran por litros; la leche que producen sus ganados; ya que es muy buena. Por otra parte, su esposa le ayuda en el cuidado de sus sembríos de papa, que también cultiva, para su consumo propio. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen maría” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está muy contento pues tendrá, apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Carlos de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una vaca; para incrementar su ganado.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 36, is a responsible family man. He lives with his wife of 17 years, Dora, and their two children, Sherly and Maricielo, in their own home. They live in the hamlet of Trancapampa. In the mornings, he works on road maintenance; the rains and traffic wear on the roads, and mud builds up. Thanks to this work, he makes extra money; he receives a monthly salary from the local government. However, his main income comes from livestock. He has seven good-quality dairy cows. He uses their milk for making small cheeses called "bolillos". His milk is also bought by the litre by milk merchants because it is very good. 
His wife helps him by caring for their potato crops, which they cultivate for personal consumption. Carlos belongs to the "Virgen Maria" communal bank, and this is his second loan with MFP. He is very happy to have this financial support, because it will ensure that he can continue with his business. He promises to repay his quotas. He is very happy to be part of his communal bank, because all of the members are responsible and united. Upon receiving your support, Carlos will invest this money in the purchase of a cow to increase his holdings.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 60-years-old. She lives in the village Misaktsieli, East Georgia, with her husband Beldar. Beldar works in the village. Ketevan heads the agricultural part of the farm business. The family owns 30 hens. Also, they have a pig and a calf. Ketevan sells eggs and piglets at the  local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Ketevan requested credit for purchasing a milking cow. She will produce cheese and sell it at the local market. The income of the family will increase and Ketevan will use it for improving family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Osooso

texts.en:
Osooso, 28 years of age, is married and has one child. She owns and operates a business selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has many years of experience in this business. Osooso needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 WST or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Osooso joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Osooso's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro, vive con su esposa y sus hijos en casa propia, el se dedica a la ganadería y a la agricultura el oficio lo aprendió de sus padre, quien desde pequeño le enseño a trabajar,  no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar ganado para crecerlo y luego venderlo de esa forma podrá tener otros ingresos, el cual le beneficiara mucho a su familia y con los productos agrícolas también serán de gran ayuda porque podrá vender también el producto y de esa forma mejorar en lo económico.
El objetivo de Pedro es tener éxito en su negocio, obtener lo básico para su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro lives with is wife and children in their own house. He raises cattle and works in agriculture. He learned this livelihood from his father, who taught him to work from the time he was very young. He does not have a set schedule.  

He will use the loan to buy cattle to fatten them and then sell them so that he can have additional income. This will benefit his family very much. The agricultural products will also be a big help because he will be able to sell them and thereby improve his economic situation. 

Pedro’s goal is to have success in his business and to obtain the basics for his family.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, ella tiene su negocio de panadería la cual elabora: pan francés, pan dulce, no tiene un horario establecido el oficio lo aprendió gracias al apoyo de su madre quien  siempre se ha dedicado al mismo negocio el cual ya tiene experiencia.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar la materia prima que necesita como: harina, manteca, huevos, levadura y azúcar al tener la materia prima disponible para elaborar los productos y atender mejor a la clientela y de esa forma podrá mejorar los ingresos.
L a aspiración de Nelly es tener éxito en su negocio mejorar en su clientela y cubrir otros lugares repartiendo el pan cada día y ayudarles a sus hijos con los estudios para que se superen y tengan éxito en la vida.
texts.en:
Nelly lives with her husband and their children. She has a business selling bread that she makes: French bread and sweet bread. She doesn’t have a set schedule. She learned this livelihood from her mother, who has always worked in this business and has experience.

She will use the loan to buy the ingredients she needs, such as: flour, shortening, eggs, yeast, and sugar. She will have the ingredients available to make her products and therefore tend better to her customers and she will be able to improve her income.

Nelly’s aspiration is to have success in her business, improve her customer base, reach other places by distributing bread every day, and help her children with their studies so that they can excel and be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy flour, shortening, eggs, yeast, and sugar

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo que se reúnen cada 15 días en Los Bajos de la ciudad de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su riqueza cultural y por su gran artesanía como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país.

Aquí vive la señora Carmen, tiene  39 años  de edad, es madre soltera de dos  hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad que estudian en colegio y escuela. Ella vive en casa de su mamá. Lleva más de seis años  en el Banco Comunal, es la secretaria del grupo y le gusta porque aquí se siente como en familia.

Ella se dedica a muchas actividades ya que además de ser una muy buena ama de casa también es auxiliar de enfermería, comerciante y  Artesana, elabora sombreros de paja toquilla y esto lo hace por las noches ya que también tres días a la semana se dedica a recorrer su localidad vendiendo cosméticos, ella dice que todo trabajo es bueno y que tiene que hacerlo por el bienestar de su familia, elabora los sombreros de paja toquilla y luego los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para luego llevarlos a otros lugares para su comercialización.  Lleva más de 14 años realizando esta actividad y que esto lo aprendió de su mamá.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que es así como ciclo a ciclo puede sacar adelante su negocio, nos cuenta que su negocio ha estado muy bueno y que en los pagos no tuvo ningún problema ya que ella es muy cumplida y le gusta quedar bien para seguir recibiendo la ayuda de los créditos que ha sido de mucha ayuda en su vida ya que con las ganancias ella puede financiar la educación de sus hijos y los arreglos de su casa.
 
Este crédito es para comprar cosméticos y paja toquilla para elaborar los sombreros.
 
Su sueño  ver que sus hijos sean muy buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Con Amor Y Fe Hacia el Desarrollo Communal Bank [With Love and Faith Towards Development] meets every 15 days in Los Bajos in the city of Montecristi, a city known for its rich culture and its handicrafts. Its straw hats, for example, are known throughout the country as well as internationally.

Carmen, who is thirty-nine years old and a single mother with two children aged fourteen and twelve, lives here. Her children attend high school and elementary school. She lives in her mother’s house. She has been with the Communal Bank for more than six years and is the group secretary. Carmen likes being a member because she feels like she is part of a family. 

She is involved in many activities in addition to being a good homemaker. Carmen also works as a nurse’s assistant, a merchant, and an artisan. She makes straw hats in the evenings since she spends three days a week traveling through town selling cosmetics. Carmen says that all work is good and that she has to work for her family’s well-being. She makes straw hats and then delivers them to merchants who come to her house to pick them up before taking them to other places to sell. She has been in business for more than 14 years and learned this trade from her mother.

She is requesting the loan again since it is in this way, cycle to cycle, that she is able to get ahead with her business. She tells us that her business has been very good and that she has had no problems making payments since she is very committed and she likes being able to continue to receive the help the loans have provided her. The loans have been a great help to her in her life since with her earnings she is able to pay for her children’s education and also to make repairs to her house.

This loan is to purchase cosmetics and straw to make hats.

Her dream is to see her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to acquire straw to make hats and to purchase cosmetics to sell.
